dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is shortly after midnight on an icy night. An old yellow Mustang pulls alongside the curb on a sleaz section of Hollywood Boulevard. The passenger door opens VIVIAN steps out. She quickly shuts the door and walks aw the car as if it wasn't there. Cold white breath floats f bright red lips. Dressed in a tight purple leather mini-skirt, sheer black stockings and a white imitation fur jacket, Vivian is twe years old. She has been hooking for over five years. Heav make-up gives her pretty face a dangerous and hard look. She lights up a cigarette and takes a drag. She moves gra on spiked heels across the grime-covered sidewalk. She ow section of the boulevard. After five years on the street seen it all. She has done everything and will do anything Humiliation is for the shy. Fear is for the innocent. Occasionally a car passes and Vivian's hawk eyes watch it indication of interest. She passes a vagrant huddled in a pile of ragged blankets newspapers in a doorway. She barely sees him; he is simpl of the scenery. Across the street a BLACK PROSTITUTE strolls by, rubbing shoulders against the cold. At a nearby all-night fast fo stand, several DRUG DEALERS are talking and eating. Still, except for the occasional sound of police helicopt the distance, the street is quiet. It is not bustling wit activity like a TV cop show. It is empty and lonely and c Vivian's ears and cheeks are red from the chill, but her cigarette keeps her warm inside. A couple more customers she'll earn enough for the night. She glances across the street at a bright yellow Winchell shop. Half a dozen people sit at the dirty white tables i She sees something that annoys her. She changes course. Vivian hurries across the street toward the Winchell's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the counter we see two older VIETNAMESE MEN making trying to ignore the unsavory crowd camped in the shop. As Vivian enters, a gangly, ugly young DRUG ADDICT moves her. His faltering voice and awkward movements indicate t is on the last legs of excessive crack use.

dialogues.speaker: DRUG ADDICT
dialogues.text: Hi, V-vvivian. Vivian doesn't even glance at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. She moves past him toward the back of the shop. Sitting a table is KIT, a young, dark-haired prostitute, thin and u looking. She is talking with a black OLD MAN. Kit spots Vivian bearing down on her and jumps to her fee guilty child. Vivian looks at her, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Waiting for you. It's fucking cold out there.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's not getting any warmer tomorrow night. The OLD MAN waves at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Hi, Viv.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. (to Kit) Let's get working. We've only got a couple hours before the street clears. Kit coughs so loud and deep that it's obvious she has emp

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No one's out, it's too cold. Let's get high. Vivian grabs Kit by the shoulder and drags her toward the

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We're going to work. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit come out of the shop and onto the street. walk Kit wraps her arms tightly around her body to shield from the cold. She starts to cough again.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: It's too cold. I'm gonna get sick.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We've got to work. The rent's coming up. I'm not going to lose my place.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We'll make it up tomorrow. Let's get high.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How much have you made tonight?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: One fucking date?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I haven't felt good.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to fucking kick you out if you don't start holding up your end! Kit's eyes water and she starts to sniffle.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Don't cry on me. I'm not your mother. You promised me you'd hold up your end or I wouldn't have let you move in. Kit wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's Friday. We'll make it up then. Don't you want to get high?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't want to spend everything we've got. The rent's coming... From Vivian's face we see that she is starting to relent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Give me the twenty. Kit reaches down and pulls out a twenty dollar bill from sock. She hands it to Vivian. Vivian stares at her levell

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're not holding out on me?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: It's all I've done. No one's out. Kit starts to cough again.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (softening) Maybe it is too cold. They walk down the street toward the fast food stand.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Are we going to get high?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just be quiet for awhile. Kit knows that means yes. She rubs her shoulders and hurr keep up with Vivian's long strides. A car approaches slowly and Vivian pauses to watch it. It without stopping. Vivian continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit approach a Latino DRUG DEALER.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where's Carlos?

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: What you want, girl? I can fix you up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where's Carlos?

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: The cops got him. What you want?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I only buy from him. When's he getting out?

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: How do I know? You think I'm a lawyer? You want some stuff or not? He holds up a small baggie containing three rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any of that yellow shit. Don't you have any white?

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: This is good stuff. He shakes them from the baggie into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: I'll let you taste it. Taste it. He offers it out. Vivian glances around, unsure, looking another dealer. Kit comes up to Vivian's side.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Let's just get it. The drug dealer offers it to Kit.

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: Taste it, sugar. Kit takes a rock and tastes it with her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (to Vivian) Let's get it. Vivian sighs and pulls out a twenty. Before the dealer ca it, she pulls it back.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Not that one, the big one. She points at a different rock in the hand of the dealer. dealer rolls his eyes around (they all seem the same size and takes the rock from Kit's hand. He hands Vivian the o rock. Vivian hands him the twenty.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: When's Carlos getting back?

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: He's across the street, girl. He points across the street at another drug dealer who ha come around a corner. Vivian sees him. She flips the deal off.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You fucker! This better be good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DRUG DEALER
dialogues.text: It's good. He walks away. Vivian and Kit turn and head back down th street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit stand at the counter of a liquor store. A Vietnamese CLERK is behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Give me a pipe kit. The clerk reaches under the counter and pulls out a small containing a cheap glass pipe and a bit of steel wool.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (in broken English) You want lighter? Vivian nods and selects a red Bic lighter from the displa hands the clerk a five dollar bill and he hands back the Vivian counts it and then stashes it and the pipe kit awa

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (to Kit) Come on. They exit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit walk down the street together, heading for

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We should bleach your hair.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (coughing) I like my hair.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You'll make more money if we bleach it. If you're going to stick with me you're going to have to make more money.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (meekly) Okay. Vivian puts an arm around Kit's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It'll be pretty. We'll give it a natural curl or something.  Vivian teases Kit's hair with her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You'll like it.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (more hopefully) Okay. Vivian hears a car slowing behind them. She glances over shoulder and sees a sleek black Mercedes following them.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Look at that. The Mercedes pulls up past them and stops. Vivian and Kit

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (grinning) There's rent. Kit isn't happy about the delay, but she waits obediently Vivian walks up to the car and leans over the passenger w The window electronically rolls down and Vivian looks ins In the driver's seat is EDWARD HARRIS, a good-looking, we groomed man in his late forties. He is wearing an expensi and tie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You want a date? Edward stares at Vivian coolly. His eyes look at her as i studying a label on a bottle of wine. He makes a decision

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes, hop in.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How much you want to spend? Edward smiles, amused for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are your rates? Vivian, influenced by his car, blurts out a high figure.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: A hundred.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: For the whole night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) For an hour.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm looking for someone for the whole night.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That seems high.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three hundred. Edward is enjoying this game.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Two fifty. Vivian eyes Edward. Two fifty is more than enough, but sh help thinking that she could get more from him. She decid to push it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've got a hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Wait a second. Vivian walks over to Kit's side.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to go with him.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. He said the night. Go on home. Here... Vivian hands Kit the baggie with the pipe and the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be home in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What if I'm hungry? Vivian pulls out a twenty and hands it to Kit.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Don't spend more than five. Kit nods.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll give me a ride? Vivian turns back toward the Mercedes and bends down unti can see Edward through the window.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Can my friend have a ride home?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. This isn't a taxi. Vivian turns to Kit.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Go on. Kit coughs. She's unhappy about going home alone.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'll wait up for you awhile. In case you get home. We'll get high together. Vivian pats Kit affectionately on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's okay, babe. You don't have to wait for me. Just save some. Vivian gets inside the Mercedes. Kit watches as it drives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits comfortably in the warm leather seat. She fin ashtray on the dash and lights a cigarette with the car l She looks at Edward curiously as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Nice car. Yours?  Edward smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's rented.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Edward. What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Vivian. What motel are you at?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The Beverly Wilshire.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Nice place?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You from out of town?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: New York.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've never been to New York. How is it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's alright. How do I get back to Wilshire?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Make a left up there. Why are you in

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Business.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What kind of business?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (glancing at her sideways) My, you talk a lot. 10  11 Vivian, squelched, takes a drag from her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just being friendly. Edward doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes glides through the streets of Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward looks over at Vivian, who is sitting silently next

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My overcoat's in the back seat. Why don't you put that on?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's just say you're a little over- dressed for this.. motel.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: They don't like hookers?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's not the kind of place that rents rooms by the hour.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Every place has hookers. They just don't like to admit it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Perhaps so. But if this hotel has any hookers they don't look like they're...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: off the Boulevard?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of tiny white lights sparkle along the walls of Beverly Wilshire Hotel. Bright flags are illuminated by carefully placed spotlights.  12 The Mercedes has stopped in a valet parking lane. A VALET the passenger door and Vivian, bundled up in Edward's ove steps out. Edward hands the keys to ANOTHER VALET. A DOORMAN opens the huge glass door for Vivian and Edward go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is bright and spacious, filled with thick carve paneling. Even at this hour there is a great deal of acti Men in business suits and women in furs and jewels are pa by. Vivian's face tries to conceal the awe that she feels at sight of all this luxury. Edward is perfectly at home. He places one hand on Vivian's elbow and guides her through lobby as gracefully as he drives his Mercedes. They reach the elevators and go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young ELEVATOR OPERATOR is dressed in a clean red uni that seems just a bit too tight. As the elevator doors cl nods toward Edward.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Floor, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The tone of the Operator's voice indicates that Edward wi have to tell him again. He will remember Edward. There is one penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian come out of the elevator into a hallway to a single doorway with two heavy wood doors. Edward pul his key and unlocks the door. With a gentle push the door open in unison. Edward gestures to Vivian to go inside. She does. Edward the doors behind her.  13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vivian steps into the room she has the sensation of fa off the top of the building. In front of her is a sunken room with massive windows revealing the sparkling lights city below. She is speechless. Edward is quite at home. He closes the door and walks pas down the steps to the living room. The living room is fil with museum quality art deco furniture, all rose and gray lavender. On one of the walls is a relief of stylized Egy figures. He picks up a phone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Room Service... I'd like a bottle of the house champagne and a bowl of chilled strawberries sent to my room. Penthouse. Thank you. Vivian still stands motionless by the front door. Edward up at her, his trademark half smile drifting to his face.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nice view? Vivian says nothing. She makes her way down the steps to living room, her legs a little weak.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've impressed you? Vivian looks at Edward, her awe giving way to a cynical s

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. I come here all the time. Asa matter of fact they do rent this room by the hour. Edward laughs. He sits down in a comfortable chair and le back.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very good. Vivian paces through the room, still hypnotized by the vi recovering quickly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't get it. What's a guy like you doing cruising Hollywood Boulevard?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not?  14

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hell, you should be able to pick up a phone and order a girl from Room Service. (suspiciously) Unless you're into some weird stuff...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, not at all. Just the usual stuff. I don't have that much imagination. Edward loosens his tie.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To be honest, I wasn't planning on having a girl tonight at all. I was sightseeing the Chinese Theater when I got lost.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Lost?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't know the city very well and while I was driving around I spotted you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: And fell in love.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Or a close approximation. A chime goes off to indicate there's someone at the front

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That should be the champagne. He starts to sit up. Vivian motions for him to stay put.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Eh, sit! I'll get it. Edward sits back down. Vivian waltzes up the steps and op front door. A WAITER comes into the room with a silver ca it is a bucket of champagne and a covered bowl.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Where would you like it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Down there, I guess. The Waiter carries it down the steps and sets it in the m the living room.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That'll be fine.  15 The Waiter heads back up the stairs and pauses near Vivia Vivian stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What are you looking at? The Waiter glances away uncomfortably and exits. Vivian c the door behind him. Vivian marches back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think he wanted you to tip him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: For one bottle?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I quite agree. Edward stands up and crosses to the silver stand. He lift lid on the bowl to reveal a dozen enormous strawberries. one. He twirls the champagne bottle in the ice bucket and gracefully lifts it out.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I still don't see why you picked me up. Don't you have a girlfriend or a wife, or both? Edward deftly pops the cork on the bottle without losing of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Both. This is the house brand. I didn't think you'd mind.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It all tastes the same to me. So where's your girlfriend and wife? Sleeping together? Edward pours the champagne into a single long-stemmed gla hands it to Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My wife divorced me and is in Europe I believe. My girlfriend is in New York. Cheers. Edward drops the champagne bottle back in the bucket. Viv holds the glass awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to have any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could. But my liver rotted away. I can't have any alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You don't have to get me drunk, honey. Vivian takes a sip from the glass.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: 16 No. I just like the smell. Fond memories. How do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Not much. I don't really drink. I smoke though. I don't guess you do?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. Not tobacco or otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It was the otherwise I wanted.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Try a strawberry. It'll bring out the sweetness of the champagne. Vivian eats a strawberry and then washes it down with champagne.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Better?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's okay. Why didn't your girlfriend come with you? Edward's face sours.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just being difficult. Vivian takes another sip and smiles wickedly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: She wants a new mink. Edward isn't sure if he finds that funny.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My but we do like to talk. Vivian shrugs. the  17

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You want me to shut up, I'll shut up. It's your two fifty. She takes another sip from her glass. Edward turns from h walks to the windows. He looks out into the city. Vivian finishes her champagne, goes to his side, and star rub his shoulders. She leans over and kisses his neck. Edward takes her chin in his hands and studies her face. a finger over her lips until his finger tip is covered in lipstick. He then takes the finger and touches her nose, a red dot.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have some more champagne. He returns to the tray and pours her another glass. Vivia the lipstick from her nose.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't like it much.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: A bit more. Here. He places the glass in her hand and tips it up toward her She drinks it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nothing puts a sparkle in a woman's eyes like champagne. Edward's hand continues to lift the glass until Vivian fi it. She takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You should see my eyes when I've smoked a piece. Edward takes the glass from her hand and sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Five hundred years ago a cocaine snorting nation of Indians was enslaved by a few dozen drunken Spaniards.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think it was McLuhan who said that alcohol is the drug of civilized man.  18

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You like to talk too. Edward smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. I guess I do. Vivian glances around the room.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So where are we going to screw? Or do you just want to talk?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How about the bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward turns on a light, revealing that the bedroom has b decorated in keeping with the art deco theme of the penth Another large relief, this one of prancing unicorns, is m over the bed. The bed itself is enormous and covered with satin sheets and a rose comforter. Edward walks over to the bed and picks up a mint lying on pillow. He tosses it to Vivian. Vivian catches it, unwraps it and pops it in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (munching) Can I have my money now?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh... yes. He reaches into his jacket and pulls out a money clip. He five fifties from it and hands them to her. It doesn't ap diminish the size of the clip. Vivian stuffs the money into a tiny pocket in her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. She gives him a kiss. Edward returns it. Just as he is ab pull her into his arms she abruptly steps back from him. She quickly unfastens her clothes. She slips out of her s

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So what would you like? Just a screw, or you want a blow job first?  19

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We'll... play it by ear. See how it goes. Vivian pulls off her blouse and skirt.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: That means you want the blow job first. Edward smiles, somewhat embarrassed by her bluntness.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Does it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. You don't mind wearing a rubber do you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Seems like a good precaution.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You look clean but these days you never know. I don't do it in the ass, either... unless you want to pay extra. (beat) Anything's negotiable if the price is right. I love money. She removes her panty hose. Naked but for a pair of black panties, she sits down on the floor and carefully lays he clothes out on the carpet, smoothing them down so they wo wrinkled. Edward sits on the bed and watches her, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't want my clothes to get mushed up.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You could hang them in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: This is fine. I'll help you out of your clothes. She stands and walks to Edward, giving him a quick peck o cheek. She undoes his tie and pulls it from his shirt. Ed grabs her wrists, firmly, but gently.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Hey. Slow down. I thought I had you for the whole night.  20

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Most guys like it quick.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, then I'm not like most guys. Guiding her by the wrists, Edward slowly pushes her back bed covers. He releases her and settles in beside her. He a finger across her thighs. Vivian lies back in the bed covers, bored. Edward's finge her stomach. Vivian winces.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: That tickles. Edward smiles and touches her stomach again. Vivian sits quickly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (firmly) That tickles. I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sorry. What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hot baths and white rocks. Okay? If I want some guy to turn me on I'll pay you two fifty. I'm here to make you feel good. So lay down. Vivian pushes Edward back onto the bed. She unbuttons his

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, champagne, strawberries, mints and foreplay. You act like you're seducing a Valley girl you picked up in a dance club. Edward laughs. Vivian undoes his pants.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm an incurable romantic.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, you were cruising the wrong boulevard for romance. (beat) But if you want a good fuck, you found the best. Just lay down and let me drive. Vivian slips off the bed and walks to the light switch. S turns it off.  21 In the faint light that leaks through the cracks in the d see her return to Edward. She lies on top of him and kiss full on the lips. Edward wraps his arms around her. They make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian turns on a light. The bathroom is large, decorated gray tile and gold trim. There is a huge sunken bathtub i corner of the room. Vivian looks at herself in the mirror. Her hair is tangle loose, and her body damp with sweat. With her fingers she out her hair to untangle it. She unrolls a handful of toilet paper and wipes the sweat her forehead and neck. She uses her finger to adjust the line of her lipstick. She turns off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is sitting on the floor picking up her clothes. Ed slides over on the bed to see her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Getting my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I thought we had all night.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What? You want to do it again? I thought I finished you off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You did. But stay the night. I'd like to sleep with you. I'll get you a taxi in the morning. Vivian sighs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why do you want to sleep with me?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't like to sleep alone.  22

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend fucking spoils you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She does. Vivian stands up and walks over to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Alright. Move over, Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and A WAITER rolls a cart out int hallway. He takes it to the doors of the penthouse. He ri the bell.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come in! It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter carries in a tray of food, a bottle of champag orange juice. Edward, dressed in silk pajamas and a black robe, stands in the living room talking into a cordless p

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Cindy, if you really miss me then take a plane and get out here. Edward points the Waiter to the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't care what your agent says. One week isn't going to ruin your career. The Waiter sets down the tray and returns. Edward picks u wallet from an end table and hands the Waiter a five doll The Waiter nods and exits.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want you here. You know how I get when I'm doing business. Edward walks over to the dining table and lifts one of th covers. Inside is a gourmet breakfast.  23

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (becoming angry) You promised me when you started this whole modeling thing that I would still come first. Now I'm telling you to get out here. Today. (beat) Cindy! She's hung up on him. Edward slams the phone down on the

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Spoiled bitch. Edward takes a deep breath to calm himself. He pours a gl orange juice and takes a sip. Still agitated, he crosses the living room to the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is asleep in the bed. She is not a light sleeper. body is in an awkward position and her mouth is frozen ha on her tranquil face. She looks young and childlike. Edward stares down at her for a moment. He sips his orang juice. He is thinking again. Making a decision.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (loudly) You're quite a sleeper. Vivian stirs roughly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good morning. Would you like some breakfast? Vivian's eyes open painfully and she squints at Edward. S shakes her head, trying to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I forgot where I was.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That must be an occupational hazard.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: This is a nice bed. It's so soft. I sleep'd like a stiff.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Would you like some breakfast? It's still hot.  24

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't eat in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You should. Come on. Edward picks up his shirt from the night before and tosse her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian wears Edward's shirt as they sit at the dining tab Edward dishes out some food and sets it in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: My head hurts. It's that champagne you made me choke down. Edward pulls the champagne bottle from its bucket.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: A hair of the dog. He deftly pops the cork.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. I'll get sick. Edward fills a third of the glass and tops it off with or juice.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Just a bit. With orange juice. I guarantee it will make you feel better. Vivian reluctantly takes the glass.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't like orange juice either.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't you like anything? Vivian swallows some orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: White rocks. Hot baths.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, you're welcome to take a nice long bath. The one in the bathroom is practically a pool.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I saw it. But I have to go.  25 She picks up a fork and starts examining the food on her Edward begins to eat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I wanted to talk to you about that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What is this stuff? She eats a forkful.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Crepes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's good. The orange juice isn't that bad neither. She takes another sip.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm going to be in town until next Friday. I'm involved in a important business deal and I won't have the energy to try to chase down girls when I need to relax... Vivian is wolfing down her food hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (her mouth full) You want my number? But I charge more on Saturdays. Especially with the sleeping thing. I'd lose a lot of business.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Hey, slow down. I'm not going to take your plate away from you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I guess I was hungry after all. So you want my number? She finishes off her glass and refills it, favoring the champagne.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Actually, I was wondering if you would like to stay here for the week. Vivian tries to conceal her surprise at his offer. Not ma people are interested in her during the day. It takes her moment to respond.  26

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (trying to act cool) It'd cost ya.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How much? Let's see if I can afford it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, seven full nights and days too?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. You can do what you want during the days, but I'd like to have you on call, so to speak.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Two thousand. Edward sports the same faint smile that he always gets wh negotiating money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Two fifty a night for seven nights is only seventeen hundred and fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But you want me during the days too. And last night you didn't get me till after twelve. I did some good money before you picked me up.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sure you did, but seven nights of steady work. Shouldn't I get a discount or something? How about fifteen hundred?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Don't be an asshole. You know you've got two thousand. This fucking room must cost you a couple hundred a night. Edward smiles broadly at that. Vivian notices.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Or more!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I like to know I'm getting my money's worth. I struck a good deal on this room, too.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (firmly) Two thousand.  Edward pours himself some more orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. I like you. Two thousand it is. But let me tell you, I have very tough business to do. There is a lot of pressure involved. When I get tense, I need someone to help me relax. That means no problems. No hassles. Understand? 27 The thought of all that money is starting to warm Vivian'

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sure, honey. I'1l treat you like a prince for a week. Anything, any way you want.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm not just talking about sex. I need some nice pleasant company.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll treat you so nice you'll never want to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fine. But I will go. This is only for a week. I want you to be clear on that too.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll be looking forward to spending my money when you're gone. Edward smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I wish my lawyer was that honest. I wouldn't even risk this, except I feel like you're a very sensible girl. Businesslike. So it's a deal?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I need to go back to Hollywood and get some things.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, I want you to stay here while you're with me. I don't want any trouble. We'll buy anything you need. What do you want? Vivian smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, a little bit of rock. Just to get me through the week. I'11l pay for it myself.  28

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. No drugs. Not while you're with me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just need a little buzz. It's no different than champagne.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Champagne is legal. Drugs are illegal. That's enough of a difference to me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I can't go a whole week without getting high. I don't know if I can go a day...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Then I'll have to call Room Service and get another girl. Vivian sits in silence for a moment. Edward watches her f corner of his eye. He enjoys negotiating. Vivian face tou She looks at Edward levelly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Alright. A week. But I want three thousand. Edward studies her for a moment. He knows when to close a

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's fair. Hardship pay. Three thousand dollars for one week, no drugs, no strings attached.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is stretched out in a hot bubble bath. Her face sh almost orgasmic pleasure. She starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three thousand! Three thousand fucking dollars! Gloating, she lies back and sinks down into the warm bubb and disappears. She pops back up, shakes out her hair and laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three thousand!  29 Edward comes into the bathroom and stands by the door, wa her laugh. He has just finished dressing and is trying to his tie tied.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Happy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Listen, lover. When I'm not giving you the best fucks of your life, I'm gonna be right here, in this tub. Have Room Service bring the cart in. (laughing) Three thousand. To sit in a bathtub for seven days.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm overpaying you. Aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey, I'd have taken a thousand, but we both know you can put up three. Can't you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (smoothly) I don't think it will break me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Then it's a good deal for us both. I'1l keep you happy, lover.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good. I've got to meet with some people. I'll probably be gone most of the day.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be right here. Edward is still struggling with his tie.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I can never get these things right. Cindy always does them for me. Do you know how to do these? Vivian slides to the edge of the tub and wipes her hands towel.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Let me see. Edward walks over to the tub and leans over. Vivian reach and tries to tie his tie.  30

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How does this go? She makes a mess of it. She undoes it and tries again.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Forget it. You're killing my back.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, let me try again. I got to learn how to spoil you like your girlfriend does. Edward continues to hunch over. Vivian finally gets somet that is almost close.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: There. Edward straightens up and glances in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Close enough. You have the rest of the week to practice. Edward reaches into his wallet and pulls out his American Gold Card. He sets it down on the sink.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Here. Buy some nice clothes on Rodeo Drive. A few dresses, not too fancy, or too sexy. Soft pinks and pastels are nice. I just want you to look presentable in the hotel. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. You want me to dress like your high class girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, let's hope you don't spend that much.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How much can I spend?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Be reasonable. You're a smart girl. I'1l make you a deal. If you spend too much I'll send it all back at the end of the week. If you're sensible, I'll let you keep it. Fair?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Fair. Edward walks over and kisses her on the cheek.  31

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: "Bye.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Bye, lover. It's gonna be a fun week. Edward smiles and exits. Vivian relaxes back in her tub.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three... thousand... dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is back in her street clothes, lounging about on a deco couch, talking on the cordless phone.

dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe it, babe. It's like Dynasty or something. It's a gas. He's leaving next Friday. I'11l be back then. We hear Kit's voice on the other end of the phone.

dialogues.text: But Viv, I don't have any money. What will I do till you get back?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Work, baby. You're supposed to be working. I'm not your mother. I'11l handle the rent, you just keep yourself going for a week. Pick up some blow jobs. You can do that.

dialogues.text: (softly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Listen, baby. I'm making good money. Good money. When I get back we're gonna move to the Strip and work the good part of town. Just like I promised. We'll get a nice place -- not like that shithole we're in now. I always told you I could get the class tricks.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's cause you're pretty, Viv. But I don't think I could work the Strip. I'm not pretty like you.  32

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Babe, I'm telling you we'll get your hair done up right and you'll be a knockout. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You take care of yourself. I'1l be back in a week. It's not that long.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Bye, baby.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: "Bye. Vivian presses a button to hang up and sets the phone dow table. She leans back in the couch, happy and comfortable pulls the American Express card from her pocket and admir

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Time to shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is dressed in her street clothes, without the blac stockings, white coat, or heavy makeup. She doesn't look so much like a hooker, but she's not altogether respectab either. She is waiting for the elevator. When the doors open she saunters inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elevator Operator stands by the controls as Vivian co He notices, but tries not to stare at her out-of-place at

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Hello. Lobby?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. The elevator starts down.  33

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to be staying here for awhile. The Operator nods.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Excellent. Vivian smiles at him. He reluctantly returns it. The elev reaches the bottom floor and the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be back. The Operator nods as she steps into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian gets strange looks from the hotel employees and cu as she strolls through the lobby. Their stares make her feel uneasy by the time she reaches front door. She hurries outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out onto Wilshire Boulevard and looks around is less confident and excited then she was before. She's a little lost in this strange place. She crosses the street and heads up Rodeo Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian passes store windows, looking at the expensive thi inside. Something about it all makes her jittery. She comes to a posh women's boutique. She hesitates for a and then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is no sooner in the door than she is subject to th disapproving stare of a SALESWOMAN standing behind the co

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (with a Beverly Hills sneer) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm just looking.  34 Vivian tiptoes through the shop as if it was filled with glass objects. She cautiously examines a dress. The Saleswoman, unhappy with Vivian's clothes, appearance voice, quickly comes around the counter and approaches he

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Are you looking for something in particular?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I need some new clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Yes. Vivian eyes the Saleswoman suspiciously. She's beginning the drift. She points at a dress.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How much is that?

dialogues.speaker: SALEWOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't think it would fit you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (claws coming out) I didn't ask if it would fit. I asked how much.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: It's very expensive. get Vivian's body tenses as she stares at the Saleswoman, vio her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's with you?

dialogues.speaker: SALEWOMAN
dialogues.text: (unblinking) Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's with this fucking look on your face?

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: I think you should leave. You're obviously in the wrong place. Vivian is so angry and frustrated she is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Please leave.  35 Vivian turns and stomps toward the door. She stops and sp around staring at the Saleswoman incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I was going to spend fucking money here! What's with you? The Saleswoman says nothing. Vivian flips her off. She th the door open and storms outside. The Saleswoman calmly strolls back to her counter and ret her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out onto the street and stands, lost. A MAN eyeing Vivian as if she were a freak. Vivian's face is re eyes water up to cry. She takes a deep breath, trying to herself. She looks up and down for another shop. On the street, wo elegant designer outfits stroll by. Vivian suddenly feels She heads back toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian enters the lobby, nervous and paranoid. She heads the elevators. She feels an emptiness in her stomach at t sight of all the luxury around her. Only this time she do have Edward to guide her. MR. THOMAS, the prim, middle-aged hotel manager, spots he crosses the room and deftly cuts her off from the elevato

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: May I help you, miss? Vivian stops, practically shaking with terror.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm just going to my room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're a guest here?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm.. I'm with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: And who is that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward...  36 Vivian face is filled with terror. She doesn't know his n Her hands are trembling.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: What's the matter? The elevator doors open behind them. She spots the operat

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (blurting it out) He knows me! Mr. Thomas turns and eyes the Operator curiously. The Ope looks back at them innocently. With a smooth gesture Mr. waves the Operator over.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Do you know this young lady? The Operator nods.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: She's with Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: She joined him last night. Apparently.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (voice quaking) I just want to go back to my room. The Manager's tone toward Vivian changes dramatically. He the Operator away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just want to go back to my room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Why don't you come with me? We'll chat for a moment. He takes her arm firmly and leads her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a richly furnished office, Mr. Thomas places Vivian in comfortable chair and then leans against the edge of his As he addresses her his voice is firm, but warm. Fatherly  37

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: My dear, I want you to understand that there are certain things that don't happen in the Beverly Wilshire. Things that go on in other hotels. You understand? Vivian says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: But Mr. Harris is a very special customer of this hotel. And we like to think of our special customers as friends. As a customer, I would expect Mr. Harris to sign in any additional guests that he wants to spend the night. But as a friend, we're willing to overlook it. I'm assuming you're a relative. You must be his niece. Vivian finds herself nodding.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Of course. Naturally when Mr. Harris leaves, I won't see you in this hotel again. Correct? Vivian nods.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I would also encourage you to dress ina more appropriate manner. Vivian quickly pulls out her American Express card and ha to him as if it somehow validates her actions.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I was trying to get some other clothes... but... they wouldn't... She can't go on. Mr. Thomas politely glances at the Ameri Express card and hands it back to her. He sighs wearily. things he must do to keep his "friends" happy. He walks around his desk and picks up the phone. He dials number.  38

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Women's clothing. (beat) Could I speak to Bridget. (pause) Bridget, hello. This is Mr. Thomas at the Beverly Wilshire. Well, that's flattering. Listen, I'm going to send someone to you. She's the distant niece of a special customer of ours. A very special customer: Mr. Harris. Yes, the Long Island Harrises. His niece is.. from out of town. You know. And she needs a little help dressing. Maybe you could help her pick something. Thank you very much. She'll be right over. Mr. Thomas sets the phone down and smiles patronizingly a Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: There you are. Go to Saks down the street. It's a tall building with a black front. Not far from here, thankfully. Go straight to the second floor and ask for Bridget. She'll take care of you. Vivian stands up. She's calmer now.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: If you have any other problems come ask for me personally. I'm Mr. Thomas. Vivian nods. He shows her to the door. She exits. He watc her go, unhappy about the whole matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Vivian walks out and surveys the r nervously. She wanders toward the women's clothing section. BRIDGET, a large friendly woman, spots her.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: You must be Mr. Harris's niece. Vivian nods.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: What's your name, dear?  39

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Well, the mini-skirt is dead, Vivian. I don't care how many designers try to bring it back, it's dead. Goodness, you look a like a streetwalker in that. Let's find you something else. Come on. Bridget leads Vivian into the racks of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Where are you from, dear? Vivian is silent for a while.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Iowa.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: No wonder. How about this? Bridget holds up a brown designer dress.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (timidly) Do you have something in soft pink?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Like a pastel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is dressed in a pink pastel dress with fine white around the neck and shoulders and a tiny lace collar.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: You look lovely. Vivian nods. She seems dazed and weary. She hands Bridget American Express Card. Bridget takes it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Do you have any shoes for it? Vivian shakes her head. Bridget leads her off.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Come, come.  40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridget is ringing up Vivian's new dress and matching hat and shoes. She packs Vivian's old clothes in a paper bag. hands Vivian the small credit card form. Vivian signs it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: We have a salon on the third floor. Maybe you'd like to get your hair and nails done? Vivian glances at her nails; they are a hideous shade of red.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Go on. It's a treat. By the time you get back to Iowa they'll think you were born in Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's nails are pink. Her hair is cut and styled more conservatively and done up in a bun. She wears a soft whi and pink shoes and a pink dress. In her hands is a pink a white purse. Her makeup has been redone. She walks down Wilshire, still quiet and dazed. But lovely. She carries a bag containing her working clothes. She sto trashcan and throws the offending items away, hoping no o notices. She approaches the hotel and pauses. Her eyes are drawn t other side of the street: Rodeo Drive. It seems ominous t She sucks in a breath and crosses the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks up Rodeo Drive again. Her manner is uneasy, determined, as if forced to stroll down a dangerous stree dare. She is better armed this time, in a suit of impenet pink armor. She darts by the boutique that kicked her out, trying not seen by the saleswoman on the other side of the window. She continues on to another shop. She takes a breath and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian strolls though the store, poker-faced but weak at knees. She stops at a dress and fingers it.  41 ANOTHER SALESWOMAN comes up alongside her.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: It's very pretty. Would you like to try it on? Vivian turns and looks at the Saleswoman. Blood flows bac her skin. Vivian flashes a trademark Beverly Hills bitch

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian strolls up the street, carrying a clothing box. He is lively, and her face has a trace of a snotty smile. A well-dressed man passes by, smiling politely. Vivian's lifts as she happily ignores him. She heads for another s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is in a dressing stall, tossing a dress outside to NERVOUS SALESWOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Nope. ANOTHER NERVOUS SALESWOMAN holds a long purple evening go A.N.S. How about this one?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Ick! I want something in a pastel. That's horrid. N.S. There's a mint green dress in the window... ?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes! Let me try that on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's arms are filled with clothing boxes and bags. Sh perfected her Beverly Hills sneer. She owns this block. On her way back to the hotel she returns to the first bou Without a beat of hesitation she marches in.  42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, her hat partially obscuring her face from the Sal sails into the store carrying all her boxes and bags. The Saleswoman smiles to herself. Obviously a professional sh Vivian strides over to the dress she originally looked at fingers it roughly.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Isn't it pretty? It's on sale. Vivian abruptly faces the Saleswoman and stares at her co

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It wouldn't fit me. Vivian marches toward the front door. She turns back to t Saleswoman, who is trying to remember who Vivian is. Vivian flips her off again, just to remind her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Bye. Vivian exits. The Saleswoman stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks confidently through the hotel lobby, past th admiring gazes of several businessmen. She enters the ele

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the elevator, Vivian is gripping her packages like loo conquered city. The Operator doesn't recognize her. He st the elevator up.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Floor, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (smoothly) Penthouse. The Operator does a double take. Vivian smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi again. Like my new dress?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: It's.. lovely.  43

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas picked it out for me.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Oh... ? They reach the top floor. The doors open. Vivian steps ou

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Bye. The Operator watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, in her pink dress but without the hat, stands in the glass windows, staring out into the city reflectively

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward steps to the front desk and catches the eye of a D CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Any messages? The Clerk hands Edward a few message slips and a telegram Edward sorts through them. He is tired and on edge. Mr. Thomas, standing on the other end of the desk, eyes E He deftly approaches and speaks in a low intimate voice.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Harris. Edward continues looking through his messages.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (absently) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I met your.. "niece" in the lobby today.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (looking up) My niece?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: That pretty young girl staying in your room. I just assumed... Edward and Mr. Thomas's eyes meet. They are engaging in s sort of subtle power struggle. A struggle that Edward int win.  44

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't have a niece.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Ah, my mistake.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That pretty young girl in my room is a prostitute. Mr. Thomas can't think how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you have a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (softly) No, sir. Have a good evening. Mr. Thomas bows slightly and walks away. Edward watches h and turns back to the hotel Clerk, suddenly in a good moo

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have some champagne sent up. Anda cheese tray or something. Maybe a pate and some bread. A large bottle of mineral water. And strawberries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is sitting demurely on the couch when Edward comes the hall. She stands up and smoothes her dress anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Do you like it? Edward strolls down the steps to the living room, studyin He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's lovely. Vivian sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I had my hair done. I hope that was okay.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. I like it. Edward gives her a quick kiss and sits down in a chair, exhausted. He loosens his tie and uses one foot to try to the shoe off the other. It's stuck. He reaches down to un the shoe, but before he can Vivian practically throws her his feet.  45

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Here, let me help you. Vivian kneels at his feet and unties his shoes. She pulls off and sets them down next to the chair.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Socks too?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's alright. My feet were just swelling up. (pause) I had an interesting talk with the hotel manager downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (looking down) Oh. Edward takes Vivian's chin in one hand and raises her hea looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I don't know what happened with you two, and I don't care. I'm paying a bundle for this room and I expect to be treated with respect. That includes you. If anyone hassles you, or makes you feel uncomfortable, you tell me. I'll see that they're fired promptly. That includes Mr. Thomas. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (happily) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't care whether you're a prostitute, my wife, my niece or the First Lady. As long as you're my guest, the people in this hotel will treat you like a queen. Alright? If I have to, I'll buy the hotel and burn it down to prove my point. Vivian smiles brightly. He lets go of her chin and relaxe his chair.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now, it looks like you did some shopping... Vivian reaches over to the end table and picks up a pile credit card receipts.  46

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I saved all the receipts. I bought three dresses and some other stuff. That hat over there goes with this dress.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Only three dresses?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't figure I'd be going out a lot. And clothes are so expensive around here. Two of them were on sale, but even then it all came to eight hundred and fifty seven dollars. I could have done better at Sears or something but...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's fine. You could teach Cindy a lesson in saving money.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (eagerly) You want to see what I bought? Edward couldn't care less, but he decides to indulge her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd love to. Vivian jumps up, runs to the couch, and picks one of the she brought home. She opens it to reveal a long mint gree dress. She unzips her dress and pulls it off. Underneath she is a soft pink teddy. She picks up the green dress and start put it on.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: New underwear too? Vivian stops pulling up her green dress. She lets it drop floor and models the teddy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, like it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Good, I got another one that matches this dress.  47 She steps out of the green dress and runs over to a bag containing some underwear. She throws off the pink teddy puts on the green one.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: And I got a white one too, for my yellow dress. I couldn't find a yellow one. She holds up the white teddy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I kinda thought they were sexy. But classy too...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. The front door chimes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's Room Service.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (joking) Maybe I should answer it in my teddy. Give him a thrill?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's not.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) No. I wasn't going to. I was just kidding. Vivian pulls on the mint green dress. She zips it up and up the steps to the door. She pulls the door open to reve BELLBOY with a tray of food.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Come on in. Put it down there. The Bellboy carries the tray down the stairs. He sets it and returns to the door. Without getting up from the chai Edward hands him a five dollar bill as he passes. After he has exited, Vivian shuts the door. Edward wearily gets up and walks over to the tray of food pulls the champagne from the bucket and pops the cork. He a glass for Vivian. He opens the mineral water and pours into a champagne glass. As Vivian comes down the steps Edward hands her the champ Vivian takes it. Edward holds up his glass of water.  48

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Cheers. They clink their glasses together. Vivian takes a long sw of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm starting to like this stuff. Let me show you the yellow one. She returns to her clothes and puts it on. It has a conservative, almost businesslike look to it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Like it? Edward carries the bottle of champagne over to her and re her glass. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I like it. I'm pleased.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Great. Now I'll show you the good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The good stuff?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (between champagne sips) Well, I figured you weren't going to be taking me out a lot, so I figured what I really needed was some sexy lingerie for when I was in. Vivian moves over to another set of boxes. She pauses and Edward suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why don't you relax while I show you? Edward sits down.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN'S OUTFITS
dialogues.text: As Edward sits in the chair Vivian changes from outfit to She slides up to him in a sexy long white lace and silk nightgown. She does a turn so he can see it. He smiles. V tosses the nightgown into his lap as she tries on somethi She takes a long sip from her champagne glass as she show sexy pair of red tap pants and matching camisole. Edward refills her glass as she shows him a black corset stockings.  49 Vivian tosses the stockings onto Edward. He is accumulati pile of lingerie on his lap. Vivian comes up to him in a short bright pink nightie. Ve drunk, she sits on his lap and finishes off the last of h champagne. She lets the glass drop to the carpet and kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward carries a drunk Vivian into the bedroom and gently her out on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Did I do good? Edward rolls her into the covers.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. He takes off his coat and shirt.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I got most of it at this great sale. A lot of it's polyester, but that white one is real silk. Edward pulls off his pants and climbs into bed with her. pulls him into her arms and snuggles up to him drunkenly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It only cost around two thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You did very well.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (a little worried) Are you going to let me keep it all?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. It's yours. Vivian's eyes light up. She kisses Edward warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Edward eat breakfast at the living room dining Vivian is dressed in one of her sexy nightgowns.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What do you do all day while you're gone?  50

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Meet with lawyers and stockbrokers. Read financial reports. It's pretty boring.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm acquiring a company.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What kind of company?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's called Kross Enterprises. It used to build ships. Nowadays it doesn't do much of anything.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why would you want it? Edward takes a sip of his orange juice and looks at Vivia sideways.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are you really curious?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: All right. Warn me if I bore you. Twenty years ago Kross was a huge corporation, and even though they're almost bankrupt today, they still have millions in assets. Real estate, equipment, pension funds. Things that can be liquidated to generate cash. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What are pension funds?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's cash invested in various accounts to pay worker's retirement and health benefits. Sometimes it's hard to get at. But with good lawyers you can usually strip them down since only part have been contractually promised to the employees. Anyhow, we figure Kross is worth about 400 million. We hope we can acquire it for between two and three hundred million. No matter what, I'm going to make a profit. The question is how large.  51

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (thinking hard) If it's worth that much money, why doesn't somebody else try to buy it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Try is the key word there. People have tried. But not everyone has a hundred million to toy around with like this. And I know of assets the corporation owns that other people aren't aware of. It's worth more than most people think. Besides, the company management isn't particularly happy about being sold, because they'll be out of a job.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I wouldn't lose any sleep over them. They got the corporation into the mess it's in now.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So you can make all that money just by buying it and then selling everything?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (admiringly) What a racket!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So that's how you got rich? Buying companies?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. It's been passed down through the family. But I've doubled it in the last eight years. These are good days for making money.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: That's great. Edward shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to get dressed, I have a meeting at ten. Tomorrow I'll give you a lesson on short selling.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're a good listener. I like that. He stands up and gives her a kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, fully dressed, is standing at the front door as ties his tie. She finishes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How does it look? Do I need to check it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. I've got it down. It looks great. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll see you this evening. 52 Vivian He exits. Vivian stands by the door for a moment and then down the living room steps. She opens a large cabinet in the wall that conceals a tel She switches it on and lies down on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is being led through the corridors of a brokerage VANCE, a well-dressed young stockbroker.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We can't buy any more stock without filing. I just can't conceal it any longer. We might hide it under another name for a week or two, but we could get into trouble later.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, no. Let's play by the rules. We'll just move quickly.  53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How about hamburgers? Do you have any hamburgers? Great. And fries. And ketchup. Yeah. I'm in the penthouse. The penthouse on the top floor. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vance come out of a doorway on to the rooftop large skyscraper. There is a sleek corporate helicopter w on a landing pad. Edward and Vance lower their heads as t fight through the wind generated by the propellers. As they near the helicopter, a young man in a business su JAKE, comes out to greet them. They all have to shout ove sound of the engines.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, this is Jake Conway. He's our top researcher. He'll be giving us the tour.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good to meet you. They all climb into the helicopter. It takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty plate that once held a hamburger sits on the din table. Vivian is stretched out on the couch. She had been watchi television for hours. She flips through the channels usin remote control. There's nothing on. She turns the television off. She lays her head down on t couch and stares off into the distance, bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out of the elevator wearing her mint green d She strolls though the lobby on her way to the hotel dry store.  54 She spots Mr. Thomas. With a wicked look on her face she up behind him and puts a arm on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. How are you? Mr. Thomas looks at her uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Fine. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How do you like my dress? Better? Hey?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's very pretty. The color is very good on you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. See ya. She smiles brightly and saunters off. Mr. Thomas watches more amused than annoyed at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian buys a pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits in the bathtub smoking a cigarette. It isn't satisfying. She tears off the filter and takes a few drag She gives up and tosses it into the toilet. She sinks int tub.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: How the fuck am I going to last a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter flies over the port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over a huge shipyard as Jake describes it for E  55

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: This is the jewel in Kross's crown. Prime industrial property straddling the Port of Long Beach and Los Angeles. We can strip out all the heavy equipment. Some of the cranes are very valuable overseas. World War II stuff that nobody builds anymore because it costs too much. The Japanese are salivating for them. Edward points toward one of the edges of the shipyard.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's that long building over there?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Waste processing plant. They don't use it anymore. Most of the yard we'll just level. The real estate possibilities are endless. In fact, I talked to a couple developers -- under the table, of course -- and they said we could...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) You what?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (tentatively) I talked to some developers about the land.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What kind of idiot are you? You don't talk to anyone about this but me!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. They're close friends; they'd never breathe a word... Edward glares at Vance.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Where did you dig this moron up? Vance angrily turns on Jake.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: He's absolutely right, Jake. That was an incredibly stupid thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You people are supposed to be professionals.  56

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It won't happen again. I'11 pull Jake off the project.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. Don't bother. He's probably already told everyone he knows.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Forget it. Let's go up the coast. I want to look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, Vance, and Jake enter a large meeting room. Sitti one end of a long conference table, piles of papers sprea before him, is WILLIAM, a crafty-looking lawyer with wire glasses. Edward smiles broadly upon seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill! Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Working on your damned pension funds. I've found the angle. We can bleed them dry.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, if your boys at the brokerage don't leak the whole deal.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Leak? What?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Skip it. Jake's going to be good from now on. Aren't you? Edward gives Jake a friendly pat on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Listen, there's something you need to look into right away. There's a chemical treatment plant at that shipyard. I want you to see if the permits are still valid. And what kind of limits are on them.  57

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Treatment plant? What... oh! You son of a bitch! What a brain!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't get too excited yet. Check the permits first. Edward sits down next to William. He glances back at the two men. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tour. Keep your mouths shut. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
