dialogues.text: Yes, sir. William glances at Edward quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What are you ragging them about?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Ask them. Where are we at?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The Board knows we're after them. A call came down from Kross. He wants to talk to you alone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (laughing) About what?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Your intentions.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I don't think you should.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I wouldn't miss it for the world.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'll have to be present when you talk.  58

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. Everyone knows you're my muscle. If the three of us sit down together then we might as well announce it in the Wall Street Journal. I'11 meet him in public for dinner. Less suspicious. Tonight, if you can arrange it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I can. But you shouldn't go alone. He might claim that you tried to blackmail him or something.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll bring a girl. That'll keep it all on a friendly level.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That might do. You brought Cindy along?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, the little cunt's in New York. Pretending she's a model. World's only five-foot two-inch model. But I've got a little girl to keep me company while I'm here. She'll do for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Alright. I'1l set it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, dressed in a teddy, is dozing on the couch with t on. The phone rings. Vivian wakes up with a start. She looks unsure. It rings again. She debates whether to pick it up rings again. Finally she picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (firmly) Don't ever pick up the phone. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't know. You didn't tell me...  59

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's alright this time. I needed to talk to you. But from now on, you don't ever answer it. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We're going out to dinner tonight. I want you to look your best. I don't think you have any clothes that will do. Go buy something a little more formal. Something dark and low cut. But tasteful. Spend whatever you have to. If you don't know what to get, tell the salesgirl you're dining at Rex. And have your hair done. We're a little pushed for time so I'1l meet you in the lobby at seven forty-five. ‘Bye.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Bye. Vivian slowly sets the phone down. INT. DRESSING ROOM AT SAKS —- DAY Vivian is in a private dressing room as Bridget helps her into a tight-fitting black evening dress. Bridget tugs upward on the sides of the strapless dress a shakes it a bit to get Vivian's breasts in place.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: There we go. Take a breath. Vivian sucks in and Bridget zips up the back. Vivian step and looks at herself in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Your uncle will like this. A sheepish look spreads across Vivian's face.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He's not really my uncle. Bridget shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: They never are.  60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her hair done up and bound with a string of imitatio diamonds, Vivian looks elegantly sexy in her black evenin The only thing spoiling the picture as she waits in the l the sloppy way she drags on a cigarette. She gets more than a couple of admiring glances from male patrons. She spots Mr. Thomas standing behind the check-i counter and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nervously) How do I look? Mr. Thomas smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Stunning. But Miss Vivian, it really isn't necessary for me to approve every outfit you wear. Vivian puffs away on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm just shaking ‘cause Edward is taking me to this really fancy place. The Rex? Is that a nice place? The ashes from Vivian's cigarette fall to the carpeted fl Mr. Thomas winces. He slides an ashtray toward her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh sorry. She stashes out her cigarette in the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's a very nice restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Do I look okay for it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You look fine. Mind what fork you use.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (absently) Yeah... She spots Edward entering the lobby. He gestures for her to him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Got to go. ‘Bye.  61 She quickly crosses the lobby toward him. As she does, he sours as a thought comes to her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Fork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An array of different forks are neatly lined up on the ta next to Vivian's salad plate. She stares down at them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll be happy to look into it for you. To be honest, I don't know if we've bought any of your stock. Edward sits across the table from Vivian. He selects the fork on the left of the plate and begins eating the salad

dialogues.speaker: KROSS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't play any fucking games with me, Harris. You know damn well what stock you have and what you don't. Sitting next to Vivian is JAMES KROSS, in his early 70's, self-made millionaire industrialist. In his youth he was in a steel mill and during World War II pioneered the use welding instead of riveting in the construction of war sh But age is beginning to take its toll on him. His skin is unhealthy looking and his large hands sometimes tremble w speaks. He picks up the fork closest to his plate and starts to p the salad.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I know you have control over at least twenty percent of the stock.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (calmly) Then call the S.E.C. Vivian glances back and forth between Kross and Edward's trying to figure out which one she should use. Does each use a different one?

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: If you push me I might.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (politely) Are you threatening me?  62 Edward notices Vivian out of the corner of his eye. She l him helplessly. He studies her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: You might have some explaining to do. Those guys are tired of parasites like you jerking them around. As he talks, Edward eyes Vivian and gently taps his finge empty spot where his fork had been. Vivian gingerly picks that fork from her setting. Edward winks at her. She star eat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Really, Mr. Kross. I don't think we have anything to talk about. Maybe you should see my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I came here to talk to you. Not to eat succotash or stare at your girlfriend's tits. I want to talk business. Edward sets down his fork, abruptly stands, and places hi next to his plate. He nods toward Vivian. Vivian has just stuffed her mouth full of salad. She look Edward confused.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's go, Vivian. Vivian obediently stands, still clinging to her fork.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Harris, wait. Kross stands as well. Edward stares at him coolly.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was out of line. Edward says nothing. He starts to turn away. Kross quickl turns toward Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Miss, I'm sorry about that remark. I apologize. It was uncalled for. Vivian finishes chewing and swallows quickly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, it's okay. Edward looks over at Vivian with stern sympathy.  63

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are you sure, Viv? Edward has never called her "Viv" before. Vivian stares a unsure. She doesn't know what to say, what he wants from She glances at Kross, who waits for her reply.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... it's okay. Edward picks up his napkin and slowly sits. Vivian and Kr sit. Edward leans toward Kross and speaks to him in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I didn't have to come here. I don't have to talk to you. If you have something to say you better say it without threatening me or insulting the lady. Kross hands tremble as he adjusts his napkin onto his lap tries to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'll get to the point. I think you're trying to take over my company. If you do get it, and if what I've been told about you is true, you'll liquidate it. (pause) I don't want that to happen. I built this company up myself. I've run it for forty years. We're in bad shape right now, but we're going to get through it.. As Kross talks, the WAITER comes by and checks their sala Edward indicates that he's finished. The Waiter begins collecting plates. Vivian, though she's finished her sala still clinging to her fork. The Waiter pauses at her side sees him and sets down her fork. He whisks the plate away

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I came here to talk to you man-to-man to see if I can reason with you. What do I have to do to get you to call off the dogs?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't understand you.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: What would it cost to buy out your stock? Name your price.  64

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I really don't know. But from what I've heard, your company doesn't have any cash. The Waiter returns with the next dish. He sets a plate in of each of them. As they talk, Edward subtly lifts the co fork and taps it to the table. He half smiles at Vivian. Vivian, studiously watching his prompting, selects the co fork. They both begin to eat.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Not.. right now. But we're going to get a large contract to build four destroyers for the Navy. They're a revolutionary design and, once we can prove it, I know we'll get more orders. I could give you a promissory note.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then I'd be in a position of making your company a loan. That doesn't seem to make much sense.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: We'd pay you interest. As soon as we get the contract -- Edward shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Mr. Kross, you're not going to be getting any Navy contracts.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: (upset) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Just that. You're not going to be getting any new contracts from the military. I know.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You've sabotaged them?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You flatter me if you think I can tell the Pentagon what to do. But I do know you aren't getting the contract. Kross sits quietly dazed. Much as he would like to believ a lie, he knows Edward is telling the truth.  65 Vivian half watches him as she eats from her plate. Edwar a bite of his food and then speaks smoothly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now let me propose something to you. If I do decide to acquire your company, I will file the proper papers with the S.E.C. If that was to happen, I would suggest that you and the Board cooperate with me, rather than try to fight it. You couldn't stop me, you could only lower my profit margin. If you don't fight me, you'll find I can be a valuable friend. Kross shakes his head, amazed at Edward's arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: You want me to recommend to the Board that my company be raped by a man like you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's not your company. It's a public company. We both know that you can barely keep it going for a couple more years before you've completely drained it. It's a waste of capital to keep it running when it isn't going anywhere. A MAITRE D' comes up and stands politely next to Edward. pauses and glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes? The Maitre d' whispers in a low voice to Edward. Edward n the Maitre d' exits. Edward turns to Kross.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now it's my turn to apologize. I'm afraid that I have a private call that I must deal with. If I may be excused... Without waiting to see if he's excused, Edward stands and Vivian and Kross sit quietly. Vivian eats with her usual appetite. Kross seems to be pondering some dilemma. He st at Vivian. He knows he has been beaten, but it's difficul take in front of this pretty young woman.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend's a real sharpie, little girl. A real shark. That's the kind of man that makes it these days. They smell money like blood.  66 Vivian stops eating. Kross continues, his voice full of e

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: There was a time when men got rich by building things. I built ships the size of cities! Ships that could rule the seas into the next century. Why, last year the Navy recommissioned a ship out of mothballs that I built forty years ago. They did it because they knew damn well no one could build anything better! We built this country into the greatest industrial power the world has ever known. We creamed the Japanese! We dwarfed the rest of the world. Dwarfed! This country sent men to the moon! (beat) But something happened... He shakes his head uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: We made mistakes, maybe. I don't know. We lost our way. Listened to too many Harvard fags telling us how to maximize profits. And now men like your boyfriend, they survive by feeding off our decay. They make themselves rich by sucking the money out of our shipyards. Blind to the future. They're destroying everything we built. His eyes focus on Vivian. She is moved by his speech.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Hell, I was no saint. I screwed people too. But for every guy I stepped on, I gave a hundred a good job. Men like Harris are different. They don't give, they just take. But stay with him, little girl. You don't want to be on the wrong side of the fence when this country falls apart. He's going to be a good little meal ticket for you. He is finished. Vivian stares at him, frozen. Edward returns to the table.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My apologies again.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Forget it. I have to go anyway.  67

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: At least stay for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: No. Thank you for this talk. You've cleared my head. I know what to do now.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'm not going to pay you off. I'm going to fight you with every resource I have. Neither you nor any of your cronies will ever set foot in my shipyards. You'll burn in hell first. Kross stands up.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you feel that way, do what you have to do. But if you change your mind, I won't hold it against you. Just tell me that you've changed your mind and I'll forget about this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: What are you rambling about?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you change your mind. Come to me. My door will be open.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'm never going to speak to you. I'm never going to see your face again. I'm just going to stop you. Got that? Kross tosses his napkin into his plate and leaves. Edward sits down in his chair, calm and relaxed. He takes from his water glass. He smiles brightly at Vivian and th laughs. Across the table Vivian stares at him unsmiling.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why are you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You and your fork. You were such a picture. A Waiter comes up.  68

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Would you like the next course, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (brightly) Yes. Yes, but just for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's face is pensive and thoughtful as she stares out glass window down at the city lights. She quickly drains champagne glass. Edward stands next to her. He refills her glass with the in one hand as he talks on the wireless phone with his ot

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We were right, they don't have any cash. The only card he had was the Navy contract and we know what happened to that. It's perfect. Kross is the only thing in our way and he's ready to cave in. Lots of big talk, but one push and he's over the edge. I could see it in his eyes. Edward crosses the room and sets the champagne down on a

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, that's your job. Vivian holds her glass in a daze. Edward, full of energy, back to her, as he listens intently to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do some research. The guy used to be a millionaire. But it's been downhill for over twenty years. He must be over leveraged. Where's he get his money these days? What banks are loaning it to him? Find out. We have lots of friends. It wouldn't take much. A couple phone calls. Something catches Edward's attention. His eyes focus on V head. He touches the diamond string wrapped around her ha

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (holding his hand over the phone receiver) Are those real? Vivian shakes her head "no. Edward smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: They look lovely.  69 He leans over and gives her a kiss on the cheek. Back int phone he says:

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now you're thinking. Get on it. We're going to wrap this up by Friday. I know it now. Talk to you tomorrow. He clicks the phone off. He takes it to the table and set down. He turns toward Vivian and slowly stalks toward her

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have I ever told you how very, very beautiful you are?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (weakly) No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You are, you know. Very beautiful. He wraps an arm around her waist and gives her a deep kis

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I certainly could have done a lot worse for a wrong turn on Hollywood Boulevard. Vivian turns away from him and quickly downs her champagn

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Easy, doll. You're supposed to sip it. Vivian crosses to the bottle on the table.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (coolly) I thought you liked me when I was drunk. She fumbles a little as she picks up the bottle. She star refill the glass, spilling champagne all over. Edward pul glass and bottle away from her. He sets them down on the end of the table. He takes Vivian by the wrists and turns toward him. His dark eyes peer into her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why are you running away? You've been acting strange all evening. Are you mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then kiss me again.  70 Vivian throws her arms around his neck and kisses him fie Edward's hands slide up her thighs and across her back. H them through her hair and unties the bun. Vivian shakes h out and it falls across her shoulders. Edward gazes into her eyes. Vivian looks away. She roughl unzips the back of her dress and pulls it from her should Before she can get it off, Edward grabs her by the wrists

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why are you in such a hurry? Vivian says nothing, her eyes are on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Am I so ugly to you? Am I fat and disgusting? Do I smell bad?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (softly) No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: People have been so bold as to tell me I'm somewhat attractive. Aren't I to you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're very... handsome.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then why are you in such a rush to get it over with? We have all night. Is it really such a chore? Are you so jaded that you never enjoy making love? Vivian pulls away and turns her back on him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (firmly) Not with customers.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not? I think I've been pretty good to you the last few days. Haven't I treated you well? Vivian stands silently for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (softly) yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I can't hear you.  Edward takes her by the shoulder and spins her around. are full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? Vivian says nothing. Edward shakes her gently.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's your fucking champagne. You got me all weird inside. I drank too much.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (gently) Tell me why you're crying.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! (desperately) What do you want from me?!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My money's worth. Another tear slides from Vivian's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've given it to you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No you haven't. I thought I had you for a week, but you're keeping something from me. It's hidden back there in a dark corner of your eyes. In the shadows. And every time I see you keeping it from me it makes me want you more and more. Why are you so determined to hold back?. Let me have it. Let me see it in your eyes for a few days. It's only for a week. Is that so much to ask? Edward gently takes her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're saying. You don't make any sense. Just let me go, please. Let me go. Her eyes 71  72 Edward kisses her tenderly. Vivian is limp in his arms, t rolling down her neck.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you want me to make love to you? Vivian looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: yes...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: There. That's all I wanted. Vivian's eyes focus upon him. She reaches up and, with tr lips, she kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, dressed in a white silk nightgown, sits on the ca the middle of the living room. Her head is down and her h a tangled mess that covers her eyes. Edward, dressed in his usual business suit, comes from th bedroom, struggling with his tie. He sees Vivian sitting on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just sitt'n.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why don't you sit on the couch, or go back to bed? Don't you feel alright?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've got a little headache.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No wonder, the way you were drinking last night. You want to do my tie?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. She pulls herself off the floor and walks to him. She bit lip as she deftly ties it into a neat knot. Edward glance his reflection in the plate windows to see if it is alrig  73

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Cindy always ties it so that the emblem is right in the center of the knot.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh. She reaches for him to try to re-tie it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, that's alright. I don't have time. This will do. Edward gives her a warm kiss. She doesn't return it. Her are glassy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I hope you feel better. I'11 be gone all day. Maybe we'll have dinner someplace nice tonight.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (hopefully) I'd like that. Edward smiles at her and walks away. He exits up the stai Vivian watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, wearing her pink dress, strolls by shops in the h lobby, half-heartedly window shopping. She keeps glancing the lobby as if waiting for someone. She spots Mr. Thomas coming out of a back room. She cross lobby and heads for him. Mr. Thomas spots Vivian and half smiles. He isn't quite s what he thinks about her. Her presence in his hotel makes nervous, and yet he secretly enjoys her company.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've got to talk to you. Boy, did you mix me up last night with that line about the fork. I think I made a fool of myself.  74

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (honestly concerned) How?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't know which fork to use so I kept holding off and everyone used different ones and Edward laughed at me.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. It really isn't that difficult.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well then show me. Edward might take me to dinner tonight and I don't want to look like a dummy again. Mr. Thomas looks around the lobby uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Well, I'm on duty right now. Just use the one on the left.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, you got to show me the whole thing. The whole dinner thing. From the top. You got me in this mess.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (amused) I..2 How am I responsible?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Because if you hadn't told me, I wouldn't have even thought about it. Now I'm all jittery. Mr. Thomas smiles and glances around the lobby again. Eve seems quiet enough. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Alright, come with me, young lady. In fifteen minutes I can teach you everything you need to know to dine with the queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas's desk is laid out with two opposing sets of silverware. He shows Vivian the correct piece from his si she mirrors his actions from the other.  75

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: And as you pick up the knife you shift your fork to the left hand. Vivian does this.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey, I knew that one. I always do that.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You had good parents.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But the other guy ate like this. Vivian switches the fork and knife.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Well, he was either European or badly brought up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, he was a rich guy too. I could tell.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean a thing. Some of the richest people I've met have the worst manners. Of course, Mr. Harris, being of old money, knows his way around a table.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's old money?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: That means he has inherited his money down a long family line. It used to be fashionable to look down upon people who became rich through their own labor. (shrugging) In fact, it seems to be in fashion again. But let's continue with our lesson. Most restaurants don't even lay out their silver correctly, so if they don't, it isn't your fault if you pick up the wrong utensil. Spoons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance is punching numbers into a computer terminal as Edw William watch the display.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The word's on the street. Stock's at ten and a quarter.  Edward smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Flight of fancy. Let's offer eight. should bring them back down to earth. 76 That Then we'll raise it to nine and close the deal.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'1l work on the papers.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So we're filing?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. Time to jump out of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and William are lounging together at the end of a meeting table. A LOVELY YOUNG SECRETARY comes in and serv coffee from a tray.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: How do you like it, Mr. Reaves?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (suggestively) Any way I can get it, angel. The Secretary forces herself to smile politely.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Cream or sugar?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Black. The Secretary pours the coffee into two cups and them neatly on the table. She picks up the tray William watches her go. Edward takes a sip of his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So, tell me about Kross. William waits until the Secretary has closed the picks up his coffee. saucers and lays and exits. door and then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, as usual. Completely mortgaged down to his grandson's scholarship funds. Best of all, he's applying for another loan.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bank we know?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Need me to call anyone?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Nope. It's handled. Nice and quiet. You can forget all about it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (sipping his coffee) I will. Edward changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So why don't we go to dinner tonight? You can leer at this girl I have for the week.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Is this the tramp whose honor you defended from Kross? You think she'll make me stiff?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: William, you have the class of a pubescent. In answer: yes and yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, William, and Vivian are dining at another elegant restaurant. Vivian is decked out in her black low-cut dre 77 William stares at her cleavage as she eats daintily, hold silverware carefully in her hands.  78

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Vivian) Tell Bill what you said to me, that first night. (to William) It was something like "if you're looking for romance you were cruising down the wrong street. But if you want to fuck, you've found the best..." (to Vivian) Was that how it went?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) Yeah, I think so. William stares at Vivian fixedly.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You look very familiar to me. Haven't I seen you before? Vivian shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You work for Robert's agency, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh. (to Edward) I thought that's where you got your girls?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You must be joking. Pay a fortune to have a high class gold-digger to leech off you. Last time I called them, I ended up spending ten grand for a skinny little thing that kept pressuring me to buy her jewels. I found Vivian on Hollywood Boulevard and she's charging me a third of that. And she's happy to get it, aren't you? Vivian meekly nods. She isn't enjoying the conversation.  79

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Jesus, Edward, you're the only billionaire I know who would go catting around Hollywood looking for a bargain streetwalker. Just because you got one bad girl doesn't mean you should write off the whole agency. When you get a girl from Robert's you're paying for discretion.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do I need discretion for? I'm divorced. And I don't need a girl who speaks French better than I do. Vivian has been an absolute doll. I had to buy her a few things so that she'd be presentable, but I'm still going to save money in the long run. William shakes his head. He glances over at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Can you believe the way this guy talks? Do you know how much he's worth? Vivian doesn't answer. She lowers her eyes and concentrat her food.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why are you always pushing Robert's on me, Bill? You own a piece of that?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (irritated) No. It's just a nice agency and I like to keep my clients happy. But if you can find true love in Hollywood, for a great markdown, that's okay by me. Edward leans over to William.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She's a real tiger in bed.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (eying her) I'll bet she is. Edward eats. William watches Vivian push the food around plate. He seems bothered by something.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (amused) What are you thinking about, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You interested? I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Jesus, Edward, don't be so tacky. I can rent my own girls.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I can read you like a freeway sign.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (tensely) I'm not interested.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Vivian doesn't care. She's used to six guys a night. Just be sure you wear a condom. She's careful about that.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ed. That really turns me on. Now can we just drop it? Don't we have anything else to talk about? Edward leans back in his chair and smiles smugly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: North American Steel. 80 William glares at Edward and then laughs, relaxing at las

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No. No way. You'll never get it. Nota prayer.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not? Vivian stares at Edward expressionlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian come into the room. Edward switches on light. Vivian walks down the steps into the living room. face is rigid, her eyes are focused on the floor. Edward follows after her. a Her  81

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My, you're quiet. You haven't said a word to me since we left the restaurant. I kind of like it, but... As Edward touches her shoulder Vivian suddenly spins and with anger, pounding him with closed fists.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You fucker! You fucking bastard! Vivian frantically pounds away at Edward, not so much to him, but as if purging herself of emotion. Edward pulls back for a moment and then forcefully grabs and throws her onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?! Vivian jumps up and runs at Edward. Edward grabs her and her down onto the couch. Before she can get up again, Edw pushes her back down. Tears well in Vivian's eyes as she at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You fucking asshole. I can't believe what a shit you are!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Would you please tell me what you're mad about?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not a fucking piece of meat for you to offer to your friends! Edward is taken aback. He adopts a gentler tone. Vivian s the couch, seething with rage.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. Just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I almost picked up that fucking table and smashed it in your fucking face. I almost did it!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I appreciate your self control.  82

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've fucking beat the shit out of street pimps. I could beat the shit out of you! I almost started screaming in the restaurant I was so mad. I would have punched you in the face and walked out of there, but... but... Vivian's voice cools to an icy calm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I wanted my money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It never even occurred to me that you would mind. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (exploding) I WANT MY FUCKING MONEY! I'm getting out of here! I don't want anything to do with you!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (firmly) Lower your voice.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Give me my money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Can we talk about this? Can you just try to calm down?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going crazy ‘cause you won't let me get high. I'm bored out of my fucking mind all day and whenever I see you you treat me like shit! You don't like the way I eat. I never tie your tie right. I don't drink enough and then I drink too much. You're always shitting on me! A tear falls from Vivian's eyes. Edward shakes his head a incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I thought I was treating you pretty nicely.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've fucked stinking old men that made me want to puke, but I've never had anyone make me feel as dirty as you do! You make me feel dirty inside.  83

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I.. I wasn't even serious. It was just a joke. I was razzing Bill because he runs this call girl service. We tease each other like that. It's quite juvenile. But I didn't think you'd mind my saying... I mean, it's not as if you're froma convent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: YOU DON'T OWN ME! I say when! I say who! I say how much! If I make a deal with you it's between me and you and if he wants to FUCK ME TOO then he can ask me and I'll tell him how much!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course. You're right. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't fuck anyone who sticks their dick out at me. I fuck who I want! I say how much! I run my life! You don't run my life!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, I'm very sorry. You're absolutely right. That was an idiotic and insensitive thing I did. I can tell that you have a lot of pride and I should have known that that would hurt you. Vivian jumps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It didn't hurt me! It doesn't hurt you when someone pisses on you! It just pisses you off! Edward's face sours. She is trying his patience.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. I've apologized. I've said I'm sorry. Now if you want to take what you've earned so far and walk out of here, I'll understand. Vivian doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you want me to call a cab? Vivian is still silent.  84

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then think about it. But we're going to get past this. I've apologized already. I've heard what you have to say. You're right, and it won't happen again. But if you can't get past it then you should leave, because I'm only going to be here a couple more days and I'm not going to spend it fighting with you. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. I'll call a cab. If you want the clothes, pack them up. Vivian stands frozen for a moment. Suddenly she spins and marches into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian starts roughly picking up her clothes in the dim l the bedroom. As she does she starts crying. With each ite clothing the tears come down harder. Finally she is cryin hard she can't breathe. She lets the clothes fall from he and starts to shake uncontrollably. Edward appears at the doorway. His face is genuinely conc Vivian sobs in fits, gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (tenderly) I'm sorry. I really am sorry. Vivian finally manages to breathe again. She stands limpl face is smeared black with mascara.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You .. (barely audible) «hurt me. Edward goes to her and wraps his arms around her shoulder touches his hand.  85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian are taking a bath together. It isn't a bath. Edward wipes the black mascara from Vivian's eyes w wet hands.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've been a fiendish cad, and I'll make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I got so crazy. I'm not like that. I don't know why I got so crazy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (exaggerating his Harvard accent) Because I was a boor, a clod, an oaf, a cretin, a dunce, a putz, a shmuck.. He washes the black from his hands and caresses her check with warm water.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: «but I shall make amends as only a Harris can. He runs his little finger across her eyebrows and down he

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I shall give you an experience that will last a lifetime. Vivian smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. You're good, lover, but not that good.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, your mind is always in the gutter. Mine's only there frequently. I speak not of the lower forms of pleasure, but of high art.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm going to take you to the opera.  86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward holds Vivian by the hand as they stand in front of display window. Inside the window is a stunning red sequi dress.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's it. That's what you're wearing tonight. Vivian's eyes light up like a child on Christmas morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward sits on a comfortable chair sipping tea as he wait dressing room. A prim, elegantly coiffed SALESWOMAN stand attention by his side. Vivian comes out of the dressing room modeling the red dr She looks beautiful. Her face is aglow with pleasure as s admires herself in the mirror. The Saleswoman checks the

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: It'll need a couple of alterations in the bust. We can do them here.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We need them done now. I'm taking her to Aida in San Francisco tonight. The Saleswoman purrs in Vivian's ear.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, you're so lucky. It's supposed to be fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is talking on his car phone. Vivian sits happily n him, admiring her new dress.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to the phone) Bill, Bill, stop panicking. I'll read the contracts on the plane. Just have the brokerage arrange the flights for me. Kross isn't going anywhere. I don't need to watch the stocks go down today. Have it ready. I'll make a couple more stops and be there in an hour or two. ‘Bye. Vivian looks over at Edward, still reeling from all the a he is giving her.  87

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is alright? I don't want you to hurt your business.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (with mock drama) My empire may crumble through neglect, but it's worth it. I've been meaning to see Aida before it closes and now I have a good excuse. But you must be freezing in that skimpy thing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No, no. You're bound to catch pneumonia if we don't do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian stands wrapped up in a grey mink coat. She rubs th against her cheek in ecstasy. Edward sits near her, watch

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's so soft. A handsome young SALESMAN stands by her side, his arms overflowing with other coats. He looks to Edward for appr

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nice, but not what I had in mind. We're only going to rent it for a few days, so we might as well get something really special.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: I have just the thing. He exits into the back room. Vivian looks at Edward plead

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I like this one.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, trust me, I know furs. I'm going to find you one that will give you multiple orgasms. The Salesman comes out carrying a long, stark-white fur c Vivian's eyes widen. The Salesman hands it to Edward.  88

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Baby seal, very rare. You can't get them any more. Normally I wouldn't even consider renting it. But for you, Mr. Harris... Edward nods. He stands up and strides to Vivian's side. T Salesman helps Vivian out of the mink and steps back. Edw slides the coat over Vivian's arms. He wraps it around he and gives her a kiss. Vivian melts.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (whispering in Edward's ear) I think I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (loudly) Of course, if you do decide to purchase it later, I'll deduct the rental fees from the total cost. Edward glances sideways at the Salesman.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't get your hopes up, Frank. We're just renting it for the opera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SALESMAN fits Vivian with a pair of red high heel Edward sits next to her. He leans over and whispers in he

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Feel like Cinderella yet? Vivian nods happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, dashing in his tuxedo, escorts Vivian by the hand long hallway as William trails after. Vivian, balancing o heels, is having trouble keeping up with him on the slipp marble floors.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Please, at least think about it. It's a gold mine. You're the one who thought it up.  89

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill, I don't want to get into the toxic waste business. What a nightmare! I just want to sell the rights to the highest bidder. Let them do the dirty work. Those processing licenses must be worth a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: But not half as much as if we use them ourselves. Edward stops suddenly and turns toward William. Vivian sk almost falls; she grabs Edward's shoulder for balance. Ed ignoring her, looks down at William like a teacher lectur slow student.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill. Cash, leverage, acquire. Cash, leverage, acquire. Cash, leverage, acquire. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I got it. Edward slaps William on the shoulder and drags Vivian off

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Enjoy the opera! Read the contracts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Edward come out onto the roof and make their w waiting helicopter. Once they are inside, the helicopter takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian looks out the window as the ‘copter flies over the She squeezes Edward's hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's like a dream. Edward smiles absently as he reads through some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian climb out of the helicopter and make th from the landing pad. A PILOT in a leather jacket and dark sunglasses greets th  90

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Your plane is ready to go, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small corporate jet takes off down the landing strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian are alone in the passenger lounge of th It is a comfortable room featuring a long couch that curv across two walls, built-in bar, television and stereo. Ed sorts through a pile of contracts. Vivian looks at hersel small mirror. Her hair is wild and loose from the helicop

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Good thing I didn't have my hair done.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh, I should have warned you. Cindy won't even let me get her near a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I can fix it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good, now be quiet while I read these. Vivian smiles wickedly and fluffs her hair up. She takes off and lays it down on the floor. She walks over to Edwa slides into his lap. She starts to kiss his neck. Edward, grinning, pushes her away gently.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go away. Vivian, undaunted, slides the straps of her dress off her shoulders. She stands and it falls to the floor. Wearing pair of red panties, she lies down on the fur coat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Vivian gives Edward her finest come-hither look.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Being quiet.  91 Edward sets down his papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just beginning to set as the jet makes a slow over the city and heads for the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, naked, stares out the window at the city lights t below. Her eyes are full of wonder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I can see the bridge. It's all lit up. It's so beautiful. Edward studies a contract. Without glancing up he speaks

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You'd better put on your clothes, now. I don't want to give the pilot a thrill. Vivian reaches down and picks up her red dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airport limo pulls to a stop in front of the San Franc Opera House. The DRIVER walks around back and opens the passenger door. Edward emerges and helps the fur-wrapped out. They walk toward the Opera House past a beautifully lit f with several graceful statues in its center. Edward has h on Vivian's elbow as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Some people say that opera is an acquired taste -- that's why everyone prefers movies -- but I don't believe it. It's something you're born to. But I don't mean that in an elitist sense. Highborn, lowborn, you can always tell when someone goes to the opera for the first time. Some love it, some hate it. Those who love it will always love it; those who hate it might force themselves to appreciate it, but they'll never love it. Maybe there's an opera gene in a person's DNA. It'll be interesting to see how you react.  92

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Even if I hate it, I'm glad you brought me.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of well-dressed PEOPLE mill around the lobby, hea toward the theater. Vivian admires the pretty dresses aro her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian sit front row center on the first balco They hold programs while they wait for the curtain. Vivia over to Edward and speaks in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: If it's in Italian, how will I know what they're saying?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll whisper some of the main parts of the story for you. But you'll be surprised at how much you'll understand by the way they sing. The music conveys their emotions more powerfully than any words. The orchestra begins.

dialogues.speaker: OPERA
dialogues.text: When the lights dim and the opera is performed, we do not to the stage but rather stay on Vivian. As the music builds and the changing stage lights dance a her face we see the opera unfold only through her eyes. A DISSOLVE from close-up to close-up, Edward occasionally l over and whispers intimately into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Radames is desperately in love with Aida, amere slave. Yet he is forced to marry Amneris, the King's daughter. The music continues. Vivian's face focuses intensely on t stage, as if a new world is being revealed to her. Edward toward her ear.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Here he tells Aida how much loves her but...  93 Vivian raises a hand and gently covers Edward's mouth. Sh eyes fixed on the stage. She understands what is happenin As Vivian's hand slowly lowers, Edward glances at her, pl He takes her hand and gently strokes her fingers. Vivian concentrates on what is happening. The music is re its tragic climax. The emotions building inside Vivian sw As the opera ends, she is profoundly moved. A single tear down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Edward stand at the top of an elegant staircas leading down from the balcony. Vivian is slightly swaying weak. Edward has a firm arm around her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Can you make it down the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just stood up too fast. My head is spinning. The blood all went to my legs. Just a second. Edward holds her tightly as other patrons move past them the stairs. Edward smiles smugly at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You liked the opera, didn't you? Vivian nods.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was.. I liked it so much. It... was sad. As she thinks about it, she feels the urge to cry again. fights it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm okay now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is lying across the lounge couch with her head on lap. Edward strokes her hair. Tears are streaming from he eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're such an emotional little creature.  94

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (defensively) It was sad.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I know. But I took you to make you happy, not to make you cry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm happy. Just sad happy is all.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You've been crying for an hour. Vivian wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just.. I'm kinda used to smoking whenever I get sad, you know? It keeps me feeling good. I'm not used to being off it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if that's been tough on you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, no. It's okay. It's just like I'm feeling all sorts of strange things. It's kinda nice in a way. I just have trouble handling it sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, the day after tomorrow I'm off to New York and you can do whatever you want. And you'll have some money to do it with.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is sound asleep. Vivian stares off into the darkne She can't sleep. She crawls out of bed. She is wearing a pink teddy. Edwar stirs. He blinks his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Noth'n. Just can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh.  95

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Can I get some champagne? Maybe it'll help me sleep.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sure. Let me call -- He pulls himself up with difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, no. I can call. You sleep. I'm alright. Really. Edward lies back down.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (sleepily) Okay. Order whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits alone on the living room floor staring out th windows into the city. She is dressed in her pink teddy w white fur wrapped around her shoulders. She sips straight the bottle of champagne. She hums a tune from the opera. She takes a long drink and rearranges the bottom of the f her legs for warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is dressed in his robe talking on the phone as he over the morning breakfast on the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Jesus that was fast. What did you do? Put a horse head in his bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Secretary hands William a cup of coffee. He takes a sip  96

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Very funny. I barely did anything. The old coot must be more desperate than either of us thought. He said he wouldn't talk to me about specifics until after our thirty day filing period. But he wants to talk to you. Get assurances that you're both on the same side or something. Maybe get you to call off the dogs, i.e., me. He takes another sip of his coffee. He waves the Secretar She exits.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Anyhow, I told him that I might be able to arrange for you to see him this morning at your hotel room. What I'd like you to do is butter him up and then drag him here so I can grill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is sipping orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're such a sneaky fucker.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The guy's pathetic. All you have to do is take him by the hand and bring him over. If we could just get him to tell us the story on the Navy repair commitments it would be worth it. Edward glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. Tell him ten-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: He'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is passed out in the bed. Edward comes in and undo robe. He starts to put on a suit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Wake up, sleeping beauty. Vivian stirs. She blinks at Edward with sleepy red eyes.  97

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Put on some clothes. We're about to have a guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, wearing her yellow dress, does Edward's tie for h

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You sure you don't mind? I wouldn't want you to get mad at me again.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. I didn't mean it. I like tying it. She finishes. Edward checks it in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Pattern in the center. Perfect. That's lovely. He gives her a peck on the cheek. We hear the doorbell ri the living room.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian stands near the bedroom as Edward opens the front Mr. Kross slowly enters. He looks old and tired. They sha hands and Edward closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Mr. Kross.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris. Edward leads him down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I can't stay very long. Kross notices Vivian standing across the room. He seems surprised to see her. Surprised and bothered. He nods to  98

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Young lady.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. The both seem uncomfortable in each other's presence. Lik former lovers who run into each other by surprise in publ Kross immediately turns his eyes away from her. He looks Edward.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'll get to the point. As I said earlier today to your lawyer, I've reconsidered my position on your expected acquisition offer. After the filing period is over, I'1l recommend to the board that we accept your bid.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Excellent. I'm sure that will be the best for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: And the other night... I want to apologize for...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: There is nothing to apologize for. It's just business. Kross's hands are trembling. He glances nervously at Vivi then back at Edward.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Yes. Business. Vivian is disturbed watching this broken man. She backs a into the bedroom and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: That's all. I just wanted to tell you my decision in person.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. And I'm sure things will go well for you.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'd better be going.  99

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Perhaps you could do me one favor though. If you could take an hour to accompany me down to my brokerage and have a brief talk with my lawyer. Just answer a couple questions.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I don't think that's quite proper at this time. Maybe after the filing period.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let me be completely up front with you, Mr. Kross. We're preparing our bid now. That bid is based on our speculation of the corporation's net worth. The more we know the higher our bid can be. And since you do own a fair block of shares...

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: «It's in my best interest to cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We might even be able to strike a special deal with you on your shares. Kross looks at Edward with a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I throw myself on my sword, and you promise to take care of my family. Edward stares at Kross evenly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be that way.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Alright. I'1l answer your questions. Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good. Vivian -- Edward notices for the first time that Vivian has left th

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me for one second. He heads to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is sitting on the bed as Edward comes in. He close door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you run off? Vivian stares at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just... no reason.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very well. I'm going to be gone all day. I don't think I'll be back in time for dinner so go ahead and eat. Alright? Vivian looks up at Edward.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why is he afraid of you? What did you do to him? Edward is silent for a long while. He doesn't like this question.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't think you need to worry about things like that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) Last time I saw him he was so strong. Now he's so scared.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (firmly) The man made a business decision. That's all. I make business decisions; you make business decisions. Nobody does anything unless it's in their own best interest. Vivian stares at her feet and says nothing. Edward watche He turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward crosses the living room to Kross.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Let's go. 100 her.  101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cold cloudy day. Vivian stands in front of the hot her mink coat, smoking a cigarette. She watches the cars by, thinking. An old yellow Mustang passes. She takes a last drag and t her cigarette butt into the gutter. She turns and goes back into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks up to the front desk and addresses the DESK

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Is there a phone I can use? I want to call a cab.

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: You may use this phone. He pulls a phone from under the desk. Mr. Thomas enters f back door. He smiles at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. What's the number of a cab company?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Umm... Hollywood like. I need to get some medicine. You know, for headaches.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Why don't you use one of the hotel's limousines?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Limo?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Of course. A small perk for the guests in our better rooms. Vivian thinks about that for a moment. She kind of likes idea, but it also makes her nervous.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Umm.. I don't want Edward to know I'm leaving. He.. I just don't want...  102

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Discretion is our middle name here at the Beverly Wilshire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long black limo drives into Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits alone in the back of the limo, enjoying the r There is a phone and a tiny television set and a small st system. She examines each carefully and plays with the kn

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from a small speaker) Is this the street, ma'am? Vivian presses the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. 1312. It's a big apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls to a stop in front of a rundown apartment on a dirty Hollywood side street. The LIMO DRIVER, a large Latino man, steps out of the car walks around to the passenger door. As he does, he survey surroundings uncomfortably. This is a rough neighborhood. He opens the door. Vivian steps out, fur and all.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is the right place, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go with you. This doesn't look like a good place for a lady to be alone. Vivian is suddenly aware of how much her appearance has c She draws the fur around herself a little nervously.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be okay. It'll just be a second.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: You sure, ma'am?  103

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. She hurries up the steps to the apartment building. The D unhappily watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's bright new shoes and white fur traverse the grim carpeted hallways. Cockroaches scurry along the edges of walls. Vivian reaches the door to her apartment. She turns the k It opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's apartment is small and claustrophobic. The walls dingy faded yellow and plaster is falling from the ceilin There are a couple of worn-out overstuffed chairs and a b piled with everything but books. The majority of the room given over to a large bed that is folded out of a couch. mangy pile of old blankets and pillows cover it. As Vivian enters from the hallway she whispers.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit? Kit? You here? She blinks into the dim room and waits for an answer. The none. It is clear from Vivian's face that she is glad no home. She closes the door behind her. She moves to a small wooden box on the bookshelf and open Inside is various drug paraphernalia, but no drugs. She c it, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Viv? Startled, Vivian spins and sees Kit staring at her from u blankets on the bed. Her face is pale and ghostly. Her vo hoarse.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, you scared me. I didn't see you under there. Why didn't you answer me?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I was waking up. I'm not feeling too good.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You never feel good.  104

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: That's a pretty coat. Did your date give you that coat?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, it's just rented.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Those are pretty shoes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, I can't stay very long. I got to go back.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You aren't home yet?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, not till tomorrow. I just wanted some rock. Is there any?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No. I smoked it all. But we could go get some if you have money. Kit sits up. She wears a sleeveless undershirt that expos unhealthily thin and pale arms. Vivian stares at her unha

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck, you look like hell. Haven't you been eating?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I didn't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You have to work, babe. Besides, there's food in the kitchen. Kit coughs hard.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I didn't feel like it. I just haven't been hungry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You have to eat. No wonder you don't feel good. Goddamn it. Vivian stands restlessly, overcome with both guilt and re

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're such a fucking baby. She pulls off her coat and flings it onto a chair. She ma into the kitchen alcove.  105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's kitchen is piled with dirty dishes, old open can various food boxes. Vivian pours a can of chicken soup in small saucepan on a tiny electric skillet.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What you doing, Viv?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm making you some soup, dammit. You have to eat. You want onions in it?

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd like that. Vivian gets a small white onion from the refrigerator and it with a large butcher knife. She throws the onion into soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out carrying a bowl of hot soup with a spoon As she stands in front of Kit for a moment we almost get impression that she might throw it at her. Instead, she s down roughly on the bed. Kit starts to sip the soup. Vivian paces around the room restlessly. She moves to the window and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: God it stinks in here. Why didn't you open the window?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: It's cold. Kit sips the soup.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: This is good. I feel better already.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not your fucking mother.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I've just felt lonely. You want to go get some rock?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, I got to go. I've got a car waiting for me. I shouldn't smoke anyway while I'm working.  106

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You sure look pretty. That guy must be treating you real good. Is he nice?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He's alright.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He must like you a lot to want you around for so long. He sure must like you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... well, he likes to fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He buys you nice things.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kit coughs again.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Maybe you should stay with him, Viv.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nervously) What are you, nuts? The guy's rich. Don't you know anything? He can have any girl he wants. He has a high class fuck in New York. Rich guys don't go for street girls.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Why'd he pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It was a mistake. (softly) He was lost. He just wants me till tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll ask you to stay with him. Vivian doesn't like to think about that. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me, Viv. I'll be okay. I can always get by. You should stay with him. You look so pretty. I bet if you asked him he'd want to keep you.  107

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: God are you stupid. He's just a date. That's all. (beat) I got to go. She grabs her coat and puts it on. She walks to the door stands for a moment, uncomfortable, guilty. She pulls som out of her coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Here's twenty. Hell, forty. Don't spend it all on rock. Get some food tonight, okay? You're gonna get sick if you don't keep eating. (beat) I.. don't know exactly what time I'll be back tomorrow, so don't wait for me or anything. She sets two twenty dollar bills on the bookcase. Kit and stare at each other silently for a moment. In Vivian's ha the rest of her money. She looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. And.. I'm gonna stash some of this here. I got it the first night with him. She opens an empty jar of cold cream and stashes most of money inside.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Don't you touch that money... I'll count it when I get back... Vivian walks to the door and hesitates again. Kit looks a sadly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You're not coming back, are you? Vivian tries to stay something but chokes on the words. S takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be back, babe. (pause) You know what? When I get back we'll go to Disneyland. Take a bus. Would you like that? I'1l have lots of money.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: That would be fun.  108

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We'll go on that Space Mountain ride. You like that?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I like Small World with all the dolls and the little boats.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We'll go on everything. It'll be fun. Vivian opens the door and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I think you should stay with him, Viv. Vivian grits her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're so fucking stupid! Just shut up! I'll be back tomorrow. She exits and closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes quickly out of the apartment building and he the limo. The Driver opens the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: I was getting worried.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Just take me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits in the back of the limo. She is calmer now. S leans back in her seat and wraps the fur tightly around h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and William stand in front of a conference table s at a large flowchart of their acquisition and liquidation Kross Enterprises.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, that's about it. Thirty, sixty days. Six months. One year. After that, Kross is just naval history.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You really think we can scam all the pension funds off on P.B.G.?  109

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hey, '78 was a great year. He starts to roll up the charts.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The only question in my mind is what are you going to go after next.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (smugly) North American Steel.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You're dreaming. Jake comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Your helicopter's ready, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (glancing sideways at Edward) Helicopter? Going to the opera again?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I just want another look at the shipyards. Before I go back to New York.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You're such a sentimental softy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why don't you come with me?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No. I want to finish that chemical bid so you can take it back to New York.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You can always FedEx it later.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No, you know me. I don't like loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake escorts Edward down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So, did you learn a lot from Mr. Kross?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Who? Oh, no. Not really. We already knew it all.  110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is sitting comfortably in the helicopter as it pas the decaying shipyards. He stares down at them thoughtful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is standing in front of the glass windows, looking the city, drinking a glass of champagne. The doorbell rin Startled, she spills some champagne on her hand. She turn looks at the door, edgy. It rings again. Licking the champagne from her hand, she walks across the and up the stairs to the door. She opens it. William is standing outside with a small briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hello again.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nervously) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I take it Edward isn't back from his little helicopter trip?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. They wait quietly for a moment, Vivian expecting him to l William standing firm.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sure. William walks past her and down the steps into the living He spots the open bottle of champagne and strolls over to

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You like drinking alone?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sometimes. William picks up a glass.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Do you mind?  111 Vivian is obviously uncomfortable in his presence, but sh doesn't feel like she can refuse.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. William sets his briefcase down on the table and pours a glass. He takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It's been a long day. (pause) You know Edward's leaving tomorrow. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. William takes another sip. He opens his briefcase and tak a small stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'm going to leave some papers here for him to take back to New York. He sets the papers down on the table and closes the brief He walks over to the window and looks out. He takes anoth

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Great view. Lord Harris sure knows how to live, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Lord Harris?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Just a joke. Between me and Ed. This must be quite a change for a hooker off the boulevard. Vivian says nothing. William takes a long drink and goes the bottle for a refill. He stares at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You're a very pretty girl, Vivian. Too pretty for the street. Vivian is silent. William stalks closer to her. He takes

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What do you make a week? Five hundred? Even that? Vivian's tone of voice suddenly becomes hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: With the right manager you could make a lot of money. More than Edward's giving you. Much more than you can make on the street.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't like managers. I don't like people making money off me. William smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You've got a mean streak in you. Don't you? Maybe that's what Edward liked about you. He takes a sip and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
