dialogues.text: There's nothing to get hostile about. I have some friends who run a nice service. They aren't like the pimps you find on the street. They don't muscle you. They just help you. Sure, they take a cut, but since you're making a lot more money you won't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, they take their cut. Then they sell you their shitty overpriced dope. Then they rent you their places... they let you use one of their cars. Then they tell you they need a bigger cut, and the dope costs more too. But don't worry, they'll lend you the money till your next job. Yeah, they'll help you. They'll help fuck you. Well, no thanks. I only want to get fucked by one person at a time. 112 William's face sours. He downs his champagne quickly and the glass down on the table. Obviously straining to keep voice calm, he turns to Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: How long have you been on the street, Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Five years. his  113

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I read in the paper once that the average life expectancy for a street hooker was twenty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't read the paper.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Don't you like it here? You got your champagne, your nice Rodeo Drive dresses, your view. Isn't this nice? Vivian says nothing. She turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What are you going to do when Edward's finished with you? Go back to the street? You're too pretty for that. You're just wasting yourself. A couple years fucking niggers and drug pushers and your face will be ruined.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just get out of here. (desperately) Does Edward want you here? I don't think he'd like it if you were talking to me like this. William half laughs.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Edward? Oh, now I get it. It's starting to make sense. You don't think Edward's going to get rid of you, do you? What do you think? You think Edward's going to keep you? (intensely) Don't you know what a cold bastard he is? He's not going to keep you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (yelling) I know!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (angrily) Then what's your problem? I'm trying to help you! Vivian spins and stares at him furiously.  114

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't want your help! I don't like you. I'd rather fuck niggers and drug pushers than fuck you! William slaps her hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me like that, whore. Vivian buckles over, holding her face in pain. William st her, seething.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Fine. Go back to the street. End up dead in a dumpster. What do I care. He turns to start to leave, but as he does Vivian leaps a pounding him from behind. William turns and slaps her hard again. He slaps her agai Vivian keeps punching him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You fucker! You fucker! In the background, Edward opens the door and enters the r sees the two of them fighting. For a moment is he confuse then he hurries down the steps and runs to them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Cut it out! What's going on?! Vivian roughly claws William with her fingernails. Edward her away from him. William, blood dripping from his cheek, lunges at her and her again. Edward intervenes. He punches William hard in the stomach William buckles over in pain. Edward pulls Vivian further and lets go of her. As Edward moves toward William, William straightens with look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That little bitch! William is about to rush toward Vivian again when Edward him square on the chin. William stops cold and sways in d pain. Edward grabs him by the shoulder and hauls him up the ste the front door. William, dazed, doesn't resist.  115 Edward shoves him out into the hallway. He follows after closes the door. Vivian stands alone, stunned, holding her face in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward roughly throws William up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? William grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That's some nasty little cunt you found.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, I kind of like her. What the fuck were you doing with her?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I came to drop off some papers and she started pissing me off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why? Did you make a pass at her?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Well, whatever it was, you look pretty stupid. He takes William by the chin and turns his head so that h see the cut from Vivian's nails.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I feel pretty stupid. Nice right hook you got. Edward smiles and pats William on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So, what'd you bring me?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The treatment license bid. Try to read it by next week.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'd invite you in for a drink, but I don't think it would be a good idea.  116

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No. That's alright. (grinning) I need to go get a tetanus shot. He wipes the blood from his face with a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh, I need my briefcase. If you would be so kind... Edward nods. He opens the doors and goes back into the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward comes down the steps and crosses to the dining tab snatches up William's briefcase. Vivian is sitting on the couch, motionless. Edward walks up the steps and tosses the briefcase out to William.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Have a nice trip tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I will. Edward closes the doors. He turns and looks at Vivian. Sh seems frozen. Edward walks to the couch and sits next to

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You alright? Vivian speaks with an icily calm voice.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why do guys always know how to hit a girl? Wham, right across the cheek. Nice and high so it feels like your eye is going to explode. Pimps, cops, even little asshole lawyers in suits and ties. They all hit you the same. What do they do, take all the boys aside in high school and show them how?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No one's going to hit you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Nobody needs to. He already did a good enough job.  117

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that. I don't know what got into him. Vivian slowly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go? You don't have to go. You didn't do anything wrong. I kicked Bill out. We've still got one night together.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. I want to go. I hate it here. I want to go home. Edward stands.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. I understand. Edward reaches into this jacket and pulls out a long gray envelope.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Here. I was going to give you this tomorrow, but I'll give it to you now. It's three thousand. He holds it out to her, Vivian doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You can take out five hundred for tonight. Edward takes her hand and puts the envelope in it. He clo fingers around it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Take it all. I may be petty about money, but I'm not that petty. You earned it. (beat) I'm sorry about what happened. I'm sorry you won't stay, but I understand. Vivian stares down at the envelope. Her eyes moisten.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're the nicest guy I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then stay.  118

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Stay tonight. Not for the money. Not because you have to. Stay because you want to. He takes her chin in his hand and kisses her on the lips. pulls back we can see Vivian debating.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just.. don't think so. My face hurts real bad and I don't feel so good. It's starting to swell up.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We don't have to make love. You can just sleep here and have breakfast in the morning. Then I'll get you a cab before I go to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I am kind of tired.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then stay. Vivian nods. She carefully sets the envelope down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkened bedroom Vivian and Edward lie together. E sleeps deeply, peacefully with Vivian's back cuddled in c his chest, his arm over her body. Vivian, her face swollen and puffy from the blow she rece stares into space, sleepless. She takes Edward's limp hand in her hands and carefully e it. The fingers, the palm, the tiny hairs on the back. Sh pulls it in close to her body and holds it tightly. She k the fingers. In a low, barely audible voice she says:

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I... love you. Almost as if she wanted to hear what it sounded like.  119 Edward stirs a little but continues to sleep. Vivian star again, her eyes filled with desperate longing. What she h to a sleeping hand she would never dare say to his face. knows only too well that his reply would not be "I love y There is nothing she can offer this man. Nothing that wou him. Yet there is an emptiness inside her this night that cannot bear. If she cannot have his lasting love, at leas could have a moment of company. She rolls over and starts to kiss him. Edward stirs.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What? Go back to sleep. She continues to kiss him, rubbing her hands over his bod

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Make love to me. Make love to me, please. Edward sighs and smiles sleepily. He returns her kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, fully dressed in a suit, is packing his bags. Viv dressed in her pink outfit, fingers her clothes in the cl She has a nasty blue and purple bruise across her cheek a her eye. It is concealed with makeup, but with little suc Edward is the model of a hurried businessman preparing fo return trip.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We're running a little behind. I have to be at L.A.X. in two hours. He looks over at Vivian who is staring forlornly at her c He tries to understand why she looks so sad.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Did.. did you want to take these back?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course not. They're yours. Pack them up. Vivian smiles. Edward turns and closes his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Except the fur, of course. That's rented. Vivian pauses. She glances at the beautiful fur coat hang the rack.  120

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Damn, I forgot all about that thing. I've got to send it back before I go to the airport. Bring it along as we go down. Vivian pulls the fur from the hanger. From her eyes we ca that it is going to be very difficult for her to part wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward carries his suitcases into the living room. He set down and picks up the phone. He dials the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Could I have a bellboy come up and help me with some bags. Yes. Penthouse. He sets the phone down. Vivian comes into the room, carry few narrow clothes boxes which she has packed her things Lying on top of them is the fur.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: When the bellboy comes I'1l ask him to get you a cab, or... Vivian stands emotionlessly, the boxes clutched tightly i arms. Edward is debating something.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh, what the hell. You want me to give you a ride? Would that be better than a taxi?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don't want to make you late.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think we have time. I'11l just drop the car off at the airport and take the plane. The tickets are reserved. Yes, let's do it that way. I can drop off the fur on the way. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Come in! A BELLBOY comes in pushing a small cart. Edward points at bags and the Bellboy goes to pick them up.  121 As the Bellboy loads everything onto the cart Edward glan around the room to see if anything has been left. He noti envelope with the money in it. He picks it up and puts it jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the elevator opens the Bellboy emerges with Edward's a Vivian's bags. Edward strides to the main desk. Vivian st in the lobby, a small figure holding a fur coat in her ar looks around the room, taking it all in for one last time Edward hands his keys to the Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Is everything taken care of?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I believe so. Let me just check the phone bill. Edward stands impatiently. Mr. Thomas, on patrol through the lobby, sees Vivian and toward her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Well, today's the day. I'11l miss you, Miss Vivian. I hope you had a nice stay. Vivian is nervous and edgy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. It was nice.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: So you'll be going to New York with Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. Back home. Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Oh. He notices the bruise on her face.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (concerned) Where did you get that bruise? Vivian touches her face guiltily.  122

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oh. I bumped into something. Isn't that dumb? Mr. Thomas sees through this obvious lie. Vivian is shaki nervously.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're trembling. Is there anything the matter? Can I help you in any way? Vivian is about to say something when Edward comes up beh them.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: All set. Let's go. Mr. Thomas nods slightly to Edward.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. We've got to run. Come on, Vivian. Vivian seems reluctant to leave.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Could... I get some cigarettes? I need one. Edward looks a trifle annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We're in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: They're just over there. She points to the gift shop.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (sighing) Alright. Vivian and Edward head toward the store. Vivian glances b Mr. Thomas who is still watching her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: ‘Bye. Thanks for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian stands in front of the counter. Edward browses a m rack.  123

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Virginia Slim Lights. The CLERK sets the cigarettes down on the counter. Edward him a couple of dollars. Edward pulls a woman's magazine from the rack and shows t to Vivian. On it is a stunningly beautiful young woman.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's Cindy. Vivian takes her cigarettes and stares at the cover.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: She's... beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She's very little. Just over five feet. But she's got the best body. It's perfect, and her face... you can see. He tosses the magazine back onto the rack. As they exit, glances back at the smiling face on the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Dumber than a doornail, though. I guess they beat the intelligence out of you in finishing school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian come out of the hotel to their waiting The Bellboy has finished packing the bags in the trunk. E tips him. The Valets open the doors and Edward and Vivian get in. E tips the Valets. They close the doors. The Mercedes drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Edward drives the car down Wilshire, Vivian is nervous smoking a cigarette. The fur is in her lap and she is unconsciously stroking it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How long do you think it will take to get from Beverly Hills to Hollywood?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know for sure. Ten minutes or something. Edward glances at his watch.  124

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And an hour to get to the airport. (shaking his head) I don't know why I always cut these things so close. Edward slows the car down as they approach a parking spot front of the furrier. He pulls in and stops the car.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll just run in and get rid of this. He reaches over and takes the fur from Vivian. Vivian abr turns her head away. Edward notices.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Noth'n. Edward stares at the back of her head for a moment, then he doesn't have time to pursue it. He gets out of the car As she watches Edward take the fur into the store, a tear down Vivian's cheeks. She takes a drag from her cigarette stashes it out in the car's ashtray. Within seconds, Edward is back out of the store. He round car and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Alright. That's done. Edward throws the car into gear and drives off. Now Vivian is crying harder. So much that she can't conce sobs. Edward glances over at her, concerned and annoyed a same time.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Now what? What's the matter? Vivian is crying hard. She can't talk.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Jesus. What is it? Can you tell me why you're upset now? Damn it, I don't even know how to get back to Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (choking it out) Just go straight!  125

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What happened to you? Is it the fur? You didn't expect me to let you keep it, did you? It was rented.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (still crying) Just forget it! Vivian tries to control herself. She wipes her eyes and m to stop the tears.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Is that it? The fur?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Just stop it! Why do you always pick at me? I don't want to talk. You always make me talk.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I just want to know what's going on. If you're unhappy and there is something I can do...

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: alone. Vivian. this.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I LOVED THAT FUR! Now leave me

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I didn't want it to end like I mean, be reasonable. That's a twenty thousand dollar fur.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I didn't say I wanted it. I knew you were going to take it back. Okay! I'm not dumb! I knew I couldn't have it. You asked me why I was crying and I told you! Edward is quiet for a moment. Vivian has managed to contr crying. She stares coldly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Make a left on Highland. Right there. Edward turns the car and they head up Highland. Edward's tense.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Look, if you really want a fur, I'll buy you a fur. That one was just too expensive. Would you like a fur?  126

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. Just take me home.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll get you a fur. I'1l miss my plane, but if it'll make you stop crying I'll buy you something.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (angrily) I'm not crying anymore.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: God damn it, Vivian. I'll buy you a fur. A nice one. Just it can't be that one. That one's too much. I'll get you the silver mink you tried on first. I'll throw away a few thousand. Okay? I don't know what the fuck you plan to do with one on Hollywood Boulevard but...

dialogues.speaker: FROM YOU
dialogues.text: Edward slams on the brakes. The car stops hard. Vivian st at him defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You want me to walk home!? I'11 walk home! It's three miles but I'll walk!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't want you to walk! I want you to stop yelling! Vivian turns away from him and stares out her window. Edw takes a deep breath and starts the car up again. Vivian glares out the window. They are leaving the nice, tended homes of Hancock Park and approaching the streets Hollywood. They are both tensely silent as Edward drives on. Vivian to cry softly. Edward listens to her with annoyance, but resists the imp say anything. They approach Hollywood Boulevard and Edward makes a righ  127 As Vivian stares out the window of the Mercedes she sees grimy streets and the shabby people mixing with the occas tourists. As they continue down the street toward Vivian' section of the Boulevard we will see less and less touris more shabbier-looking people. The streets become more gri dirty. Vivian is sobbing harder now, trying to control herself b unable. Edward, getting madder as it grows louder, finall bursts.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't know why you had to do this to me. We had a wonderful time together and now you have to ruin it. You're acting so emotional. I'd swear to God you aren't the same girl I picked up last week. Vivian grits her teeth and tries not to say anything. Edw now that he's gotten it out of his system, adopts a sligh gentler tone as he continues to lecture her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You should have told me you liked the fur so much. I could have gotten you something yesterday. It's really a stupid thing to cry about. You know I bent over backwards to make things pleasant for you and it's just a shame that you're going to spoil it all by being unreasonable. The streets they pass are now filled mostly with drug dea occasional prostitute, and various homeless tramps. Vivia stares out the window at the destitution outside, her eye and red. She is on the verge of a nervous breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This is about the area. Do you want me to leave you here, or do you have a place nearby? Vivian says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian? Where do you want me to let you off? Vivian screams hysterically. She seems to have suddenly g crazy. She starts pounding the roof of the car with her f Edward quickly pulls the car over to the curb and stops i Vivian is still screaming and pounding.  128

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward grabs her by the wrists and tries to stop her from pounding the ceiling. Instead she starts pounding him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get out! GET OUT OF THE CAR! Vivian continues to pound him for a moment but then she b down and starts to sob limply.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. You're insane! Vivian is crying.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've had enough of this. Get out of the car. Vivian doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get out of the car! When she still doesn't move Edward throws open his door a out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward strides around the car and throws open the trunk. yanks out Vivian's few boxes of clothes and sets them dow curb. He shuts the trunk. He walks over to the passenger door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (firmly) Get out. Vivian doesn't move. She is still crying.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't make me regret ever picking you up. Now please, get out of the car. I have to go. Edward grabs her by the hand and starts to pull her from Vivian explodes again and starts hitting and kicking him. Edward forcibly drags her from the car and then throws he ground. He slams the door shut.  129 As Vivian hits the ground she begins to cry again, too we fight anymore. Edward looks down at her. He takes the money envelope fro jacket and holds it out to her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Here, take it. It's your money.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sobbing in fits) I don't want it. Just go away.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Take it. I know you're not that stupid.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You'll regret it tomorrow if you don't take it. You'll regret it the minute I drive away. Vivian doesn't say anything. Edward lays the envelope dow the sidewalk in front of her. He turns and walks around the car. Vivian lies frozen for moment and then suddenly snaps alive as she hears the sou his car door opening and closing. She grabs the envelope and crushes it in her hand. She le the car and starts smashing her fists against it and the

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Go to hell! I hate you! I hate your money! TI hate it! We see a flash of Edward's face as he stares at Vivian po on his window. She's completely lost her mind. He puts th in gear and pushes on the accelerator. Vivian is still pounding as the car pulls away. In a fina gesture of rage she throws the envelope on the car and it open as the cars peels off. The money scatters across the gutter as the car drives aw Vivian falls to her knees, weak and crying. Across the street various shabby-looking people stare at and the money. Vivian is on her hands and knees sobbing. She can barely breathe. She is completely broken.  130 She wipes the tears from her cheeks. She looks down the s The Mercedes is gone. For a brief moment she is still, frozen like a statue. She reaches down in the gutter and starts to pick up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Greyhound bus drives down the freeway from Los Ang It moves easily through the traffic. A small sign over th windshield reads: DISNEYLAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit are sitting in the bus. Kit is sitting nex the window, looking outside with a warm, happy smile. She excited she can barely stand it.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Could I get one of those balloons? You know, with the ears? Vivian sits next to Kit staring off with utterly blank an eyes. The side of her cheek is still bruised. She is wear her mint green dress, but her hair is poorly done and lie around her pale face. Kit coughs.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh, I guess that's stupid. Those are for kids. Vivian blinks and glances over at Kit, tired.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, babe. You can have a balloon. One with the ears. Kit smiles happily and looks back out the window. Vivian emptily ahead. FADE OUT.
